programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Winter Sun
programme.desc: Scarlette Douglas comes to the aid of brothers Dave and Richard Paine, who are looking for a home in Portugal's Algarve that can serve as a winter retreat for their parents, but could also be used by their families for holidays throughout the rest of the year.(n)

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Winter Sun
programme.desc: Recently retired couple Robert and Carole search for a holiday home where they can spend time with their children and grandchildren in the north of Tenerife.(n)

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Summer Sun
programme.desc: Jonnie Irwin helps Stockport couple Gillian and Paul Clarke search for a holiday home on Spain's Costa Calida on a budget of £45,000.(n)

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Winter Sun
programme.desc: Laura Hamilton helps Andrew and Denise Holmes from Lancashire, who have been holidaying in Florida for nearly 25 years and now want to buy a home there.(n)

programme.title: A New Life in the Sun
programme.desc: A husband and wife face long delays as they race to open a top-class seafood restaurant in Spain, while a couple from London escape the rat race with dreams of setting up a B&B in rural France. Plus, can a traditional pub on the Costa del Sol pull in the punters during the busy summer season?.(n)

programme.title: A New Life in the Sun
programme.desc: After weeks of delays, a couple of expats aim to open their seafood restaurant without any further hitches, engine trouble threatens to end a French dream before it even begins and Spain's newest bar tries to win over the tourists with live music.(n)

programme.title: A New Life in the Sun
programme.desc: Two expats swap Chelmsford for Charente as they try to open their self-catering complex before the start of the summer, and Spain's newest seafood restaurant begins to make a name for itself. Meanwhile, a couple of Londoners host a traditional tea party at their new French B&B.(n)

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: The chef travels to New Orleans to visit Zeke's, a much-loved restaurant that has seen standards slip since the original owner died. The new proprietors, husband and wife duo Darryl and Ellen Cortello, focused all the efforts on the financial side of things, so it is up to Gordon to show them that they first need to love food to make any profit.(n)

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: The chef travels to Los Angeles to help La Frite, an outdated French restaurant that is failing to make any profits. His first step is to try to reconcile the feuding family members who run the business, and so devises a plan to bring them together by using secret filming.(n)

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: Gordon Ramsay revisits three of the restaurants he tried to save, Lido, Anna Vincenzo's and Le Bistro, to find out whether his advice has been put to good use.(n)

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: Gordon Ramsay heads for Pasadena, California, where he visits Jamaican-themed restaurant Cafe Kingston. The business in run by Dr Una Morris, a micro-managing owner who also works at a radiotherapy clinic next door, and is determined to introduce hospital-style techniques to the kitchen by sealing everything in plastic bags.(n)

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: The chef heads to Eagle Rock in California to try to change the fortunes of Capri, a grubby restaurant which often remains closed during lunchtime because of the twin owners' lazy attitude. A crisis ensues as soon as Gordon Ramsay instructs the duo to clean the place, revealing that only tough measures are likely to save the business.(n)

programme.title: Gogglebox
programme.desc: The popular armchair critics share their opinions on what they have been watching during the week. The programme captures their instant reactions and lively discussions from the comfort of their own homes.(n)

programme.title: The 2,000,000 Calorie Buffet
programme.desc: Documentary about the growth in the number of all-you-can-eat restaurants offering limitless servings of food for a fixed price, featuring interview with diners who can eat four days of calories in one sitting and the canny restaurateurs who know every trick going to fill people up quickly. Narrated by Johnny Vegas.(n)

programme.title: Sex Party Secrets
programme.desc: As the popularity of exclusive arranged orgies rises, this documentary explores the hidden world of the UK's self-proclaimed `sexual elite', providing an insight into the lives of the most selective party planners and their meticulously vetted clients. As the guests sip champagne and fulfil their wildest fantasies behind the doors of multimillion-pound mansions and country estates, the programme explores the motivation behind the desire that drives married couples, young single friends and seasoned sex addicts to seek fleeting intimate experiences and group encounters with strangers.(n)

programme.title: Catastrophe
programme.desc: Return of the comedy about an Irish woman and an American man's relationship, written by and starring Sharon Horgan and Rob Delaney. Rob picks up where he left off at the end of series two, with an unexplained receipt for the morning after pill and a lot of questions for Sharon. Too drunk at the time to remember what she did, she dodges his interrogation and goes to see Nico perform with his band to find out the truth. The issue is unexpectedly forced when one of the kids has an accident.(n)

programme.title: 999: What's Your Emergency
programme.desc: This one-off edition of the programme looks at the challenges facing Cheshire's police custody teams, with around 20,000 people passing through their cells every year. Homeless ex-serviceman and repeat offender Michael has been arrested following a complaint about his behaviour in a cinema, but he is just happy to have a roof over his head for the night, while DC Ben Hilton is called out to deal with a case of a woman who has been arrested after stabbing her partner in the leg with a kitchen knife.(n)

programme.title: Britain's Benefit Tenants
programme.desc: Documentary following the work of specialist letting agencies. Manchester agent Joe is caught between a single mother struggling to pay off her rent arrears and a landlord who has run out of patience. But unknown to Joe, his tenant has a plan to get herself out of this mess she has found herself in. Across town, letting agent Tracy is in for a shock when she discovers one of her tenants has turned a bedroom into an aviary full of tropical birds.(n)

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: Staff and patients at St George's in south west London talk about the importance of family support when dealing with difficult circumstances. Fifty-one-year-old painter and decorator Gary is rushed to St George's after falling 10 feet from a ladder. Cameras also follow five-year-old Beatriz, who has symptoms of a fever. She has a rare kidney condition that affects her immune system, making her vulnerable to infection.(n)

programme.title: George Clarke's Amazing Spaces
programme.desc: George meets a primary school teacher in Southend hoping to build a classroom inside a salvaged plane, and in Devon he finds out about a cricket-mad couple's plans to turn an old scorebox into a garden hangout. He also continues his tour of small structures in New Zealand, seeing a steel treehouse complete with automatic beer dispenser built into the sofa.(n)

programme.title: The Last Leg
programme.desc: Adam Hills, Josh Widdicombe and Alex Brooker are joined by Rob Delaney and Sharon Horgan, the co-stars of Channel 4 sitcom Catastrophe, for a comic review of the significant moments of the past seven days. The hosts offer their own unique insight into some of the most difficult and delicate issues in modern Britain, and answer that most important of questions: Is it OK?.(n)

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Winter Sun
programme.desc: Laura Hamilton helps Andrew and Denise Holmes from Lancashire, who have been holidaying in Florida for nearly 25 years and now want to buy a home there.(n)

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Winter Sun
programme.desc: Bev Cameron has multiple sclerosis, and finds that a warm climate helps her manage her symptoms. As a response, she has decided to buy a property near the historic harbour town of Paphos, in Cyprus. Enlisting the help of Bev's best friend Shelley, Laura Hamilton delivers five potential homes for her budget of £90,000, in the hopes that one of them will fit the bill.(n)

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Summer Sun
programme.desc: Recently retired Cheshire woman Anne Hunt has long-dreamed of buying a property in Spain where she can spend her new found free time relaxing in the sun. With best friend Sharon along to help her with the decision, Danni Menzies shows Anne five properties on the southern Costa Blanca for her £50,000 budget.(n)

programme.title: Phil Spencer: Secret Agent
programme.desc: The property expert heads to Lach Dennis in Cheshire to help couple Heather and Ian, whose house has been on the market for 18 months. After a quick look around, Phil sets out to clear the driveway of weeds, a horsebox and a caravan, clear a conservatory that doubles as a dog kennel, and get to the bottom of a suspicious bulge in the home's downstairs ceiling, in a bid to make the property more attractive to buyers.(n)

programme.title: Phil Spencer: Secret Agent
programme.desc: The property expert travels to Giffnock in East Renfrewshire to help sell a bungalow that has been in the same family for 37 years, and discovers its dated interior and uneven kitchen floor have been putting buyers off.(n)

programme.title: Phil Spencer: Secret Agent
programme.desc: Phil is in Ashbourne, Derbyshire, helping divorcees Sylvia and Bill sell their semi-detached house, which has been on the market for over 12 months. After 54 years of marriage, the two have decided to go their separate ways - and want to move on as quickly as possible.(n)

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: Gordon Ramsay heads to Wilkinsburg in Pennsylvania, home to Ms Jean's Southern Cuisine, which was opened by retired special-education teacher Jean Gould. During the chef's attempt to save the business from disaster, he discovers her soul-food restaurant resembles a dentist's waiting room and finds a lot of tension between Jean and her employees, who claim she is a Jekyll-and-Hyde character.(n)

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: Gordon Ramsay heads to Brooklyn, New York, to tackle a 55-year-old family business. Owner John Esposito left school at the age of 14 and has worked at his parents' restaurant, Sal's Pizzeria, ever since. Their success meant they could afford to purchase the location next door in the 1990s, naming it Mama Maria after John's mother, who died in 2002. But when he lost his father as well, John became overwhelmed by the responsibility of running both establishments and his livelihood is at risk.(n)

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Winter Sun

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.sub-title: A Place in the Sun: Winter Sun.
programme.desc: Ben Hillman shows Robert Pemberton and Carole Wheatley five properties in the north of Tenerife, where they hope to buy a winter home to embrace their passion for gardening.(n)

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Summer Sun
programme.desc: After becoming foster parents to three young children, Jo Danson and her husband Bill decided a holiday home would be the perfect way for everyone to spend quality time together. Working within a budget of £65,000, Jasmine Harman shows Jo five suitable properties in the Orihuela Costa region of Spain.(n)

programme.title: Location, Location, Location
programme.desc: Phil Spencer catches up with two couples to see if they managed to find their perfect property. First, Phil revisits civil partners Jo and Ally, who were house hunting in South London for a home big enough for three. Later, Phil also meets back up with Steve and Jo, who searched for a family home in Cardiff in 2015.(n)

programme.sub-title: The Lorelais' First Day at Chilton.

programme.title: Gilmore Girls
programme.desc: Rory has to learn a sport for school, so Emily suggests she spend a day playing golf with her grandfather Richard. Meanwhile, a complicated wedding causes stress at the inn. Starring Lauren Graham, Alexis Bledel and Edward Herrmann.(n)

programme.title: Gilmore Girls
programme.desc: Rory is humiliated when she receives a grade D in an English assignment for the first time, and begins to obsess over her studying. Lauren Graham and Alexis Bledel star.(n)

programme.title: Gilmore Girls
programme.desc: Max persuades Lorelai to come out for a coffee and tells her he wants them to start dating - but she is not keen on the idea. The girls attend the funeral of a neighbour's cat, causing a family upset in the process. Lauren Graham and Alexis Bledel star.(n)

programme.title: My Wife and Kids
programme.desc: Jay decides to become an artist and paints a portrait of Michael based on Michelangelo's David, making him feel inadequate at being constantly compared with such a paragon of physical perfection. Starring Damon Wayans.(n)

programme.title: My Wife and Kids
programme.desc: An old friend of Michael's pays a visit and Claire is grounded for shoplifting. Role-reversal sitcom about a house-husband with a high-flying stockbroker wife and three children.(n)

programme.title: My Wife and Kids
programme.desc: Jay attends a couples therapy seminar, but the group causes more problems than it solves. Michael tries to teach Junior the value of money by encouraging him to start his own business - little suspecting he will turn to fraud. Starring Damon Wayans and George O Gore II.(n)

programme.title: My Wife and Kids
programme.desc: Michael goes camping with Kady and her friends, while Clare and Tony plan to sneak out to a rave. Starring Damon Wayans.(n)

programme.title: My Wife and Kids

programme.title: My Wife and Kids
programme.desc: Jay nominates Michael for the Small Businessman of the Year award and he assumes he is going to win it after his close friend on the board hints that it is a done deal.(n)

programme.title: Killer Psychopaths
programme.desc: David Wilson analyses the personality and motivations of American serial killer Dennis Rader, who was convicted in 2005 of murdering 10 people between 1974 and 1991. He became known as the `BTK killer' after he offered it as a suggestion in a series of taunting letters to police and media - the letters standing for `bind, torture, kill'. The criminologist travels to the US to examine how the disturbing behaviour displayed by Rader as a child gave an early indication that he would grow into a psychopath, and also hears from some of the victims' families, an officer who worked on the case, and one of his neighbours.(n)

programme.title: Teen Wolf
programme.desc: Lydia plans a party for her birthday, but due to her erratic behaviour, only a few people decide to attend. A hallucinogenic ingredient in the punch creates chaos when it causes her friends to live out their deepest fears. Meanwhile, the Argents are still reeling over their daughter's scrape with Derek and decide on a drastic plan of action.(n)

programme.title: That '70s Show
programme.desc: Eric tries to make amends to Donna by buying her sexy lingerie for Valentine's Day and Fez worries Caroline may be psychotic. Nostalgic comedy series, starring Topher Grace, Laura Prepon and Wilmer Valderrama.(n)

programme.title: 8 Simple Rules
programme.desc: Kerry is furious to learn that Paul is relaxing the household curfew for Bridget just because she is dating the best sportsman in the state - high-school basketball star Travis `the Rainman' Smith. John Ritter and Katey Sagal star.(n)

programme.title: 8 Simple Rules
programme.desc: Bridget tries out for the cheerleading squad, but Kerry is chosen instead. Meanwhile, Paul struggles to wean Rory off video games and get him interested in reading. Starring John Ritter.(n)

programme.title: 8 Simple Rules
programme.desc: Paul insists on having a family get-together in the old treehouse on Halloween - with surprising consequences.(n)

programme.title: My Wife and Kids
programme.desc: Part one of two. Jay and Michael return from a night out to find Junior and his new girlfriend Vanessa in a compromising position. American sitcom, starring Damon Wayans.(n)

programme.title: My Wife and Kids
programme.desc: Part two of two. After catching Junior and his girlfriend Vanessa getting up to no good, Michael and Jay throw him out of the house, and he ends up living in a tent in the back garden until everything has calmed down.(n)

programme.title: My Wife and Kids
programme.desc: Michael is recruited for jury service and elected foreman, but tries to get the trial over quickly so he can rush home to watch a marathon showing of the Godfather films on TV. Unfortunately, he ends up having to rent the videos instead - and becomes convinced the Mafia are after him.(n)

programme.title: My Wife and Kids
programme.desc: Junior and Claire find a wallet containing $500, and decide to keep it for themselves - but Michael and Jay disapprove, and insist on setting up a family court to decide the fate of the cash. Comedy, starring Damon Wayans.(n)

programme.title: My Wife and Kids
programme.desc: Claire gets her learner driver's licence, but Michael is still reluctant to let her get behind the wheel.(n)

programme.title: My Wife and Kids
programme.desc: Jay is dismayed to discover Michael still carries a photograph of an attractive former girlfriend in his wallet, and demands an explanation. Meanwhile, Franklin finds it hard to admit Aretha is actually a very talented singer.(n)

programme.title: My Wife and Kids
programme.desc: Jay tries to spend more time with Michael by watching him play golf. Meanwhile, Junior asks Franklin for help with a college application - but ends up cheating.(n)

programme.title: My Wife and Kids
programme.desc: When Claire reveals she and Tony have decided to have sex, Michael and Jay panic and try everything to change the lovebirds' minds. Comedy, starring Damon Wayans.(n)

programme.title: My Wife and Kids
programme.desc: Claire is invited to the senior prom, and Jay volunteers to be her chaperone. Michael tries to teach Junior a lesson about money management.(n)

programme.title: My Wife and Kids
programme.desc: Part one of two. As the day of Junior's graduation approaches, he shocks the family by announcing he wants to go to college. Michael decides to help him make a good impression at the induction - but resorts to offering the interviewer a bribe.(n)

programme.title: My Wife and Kids
programme.desc: Part two of two. Junior finally graduates, prompting proud parents Michael and Jay to reward him with an all-expenses-paid trip to Japan - which they also see as a way of ruining his plans to move in with Vanessa.(n)

programme.title: My Wife and Kids
programme.desc: Michael is shocked to learn Junior is going to be a father, and reluctantly gives him a job - only to sack him on his first day for turning up late and being generally unsatisfactory.(n)

programme.title: Can't Pay? We'll Take It Away
programme.desc: Agents Stewart and Iain head to Manchester, where a landlord is owed £8,000 in rent arrears and has already called for police back-up. As tempers rise, the pair must find a way to handle a situation that is spiralling dangerously out of control. Meanwhile, Brian and Del chase £3,000 owed to a firm of letting agents, before tracking a debtor who was accidentally over-paid for a job. Plus, Stewart and Iain face an eviction that is set to test their patience.(n)

programme.title: Can't Pay? We'll Take It Away
programme.desc: High Court enforcement agents Paul Bohill and Steve Pinner are in Birmingham on a potentially dangerous, full-scale eviction of a large traveller community. Meanwhile, in London's diamond district Brian O'Shaughnessy and Delroy Anglin are chasing nearly £6,000 owed by a jeweller to an unhappy customer, although a solicitor tries to convince Delroy his client owes nothing.(n)

programme.title: Can't Pay? We'll Take It Away
programme.desc: Agents Stewart McCracken and Elmore Victor head to Liverpool for what they expect to be a routine repossession, but instead face the most challenging eviction of their careers. Behind the front door, they find a critically ill two-year-old child with major heart problems, who is on constant life support and unable to breathe without a ventilator. Meanwhile, Brian O'Shaughnessy and Del Anglin chase £2,000 worth of debt owed by a business based in Kent, and recover £4,000 from a recycling business in Buckinghamshire. Plus, Stewart and Elmore encounter another family in crisis in Birmingham, where a retired couple who acted as guarantor for their daughter's tenancy are liable to pay over £3,000 after she defaulted.(n)

programme.title: Can't Pay? We'll Take It Away
programme.desc: In Bedfordshire, agents Paul and Steve try to evict a community of travellers who have set up home in a private car park, however they receive a hostile response and must react to prevent the situation from spiralling out of control. Elsewhere, Stewart and Elmore chase a debt of over £3,000 in Merseyside, and in East London, Paul and Steve attempt to evict a Romanian family who stopped paying rent seven months ago. Plus, Stuart and Vic try to recover £5,000 owed by a forklift truck company after an agreement went sour.(n)

programme.title: On Benefits
programme.sub-title: On Benefits: UK's Most Hated Woman?.
programme.desc: The documentary about people on benefits meets a whole new group - those who are living quite comfortably on little money. They include Worcester woman Susanne, who gave up work eight months ago due to a heart problem and now claims £1,600 a month. Eager to live the celebrity lifestyle, she drives a £28,000 car and hit the headlines in January after making an unsuccessful claim on a £33million National Lottery ticket. Others featured are Carl from the Isle of Sheppey, who spends most of his time and money at his local pub, and Bradford man Craig, who gave up his job two years ago to be a full-time single dad to his seven-year-old son.(n)

programme.title: The Great British Benefits Handout
programme.desc: In Romford, east London, 53-year-old self-proclaimed business entrepreneur Lorraine finds the new family dynamic a shock to the system. Now an empty-nester, she is more determined than ever to make her longed-for market stall a success. Elsewhere, Adam finally receives good news, Kim arranges a pop-up event at her local gym as her tanning business takes off, and single mother Donna has a much-anticipated trial day at her local hair salon.(n)

programme.title: Shannon Matthews: What Happened Next
programme.desc: The disappearance of Shannon Matthews was a story that gripped and then appalled Britain. Nine years on, this documentary examines her kidnapping and why people close to the case believe the police should reopen their investigation. Featuring the insight of some of those closest to the case, the programme charts the impact on an innocent girl caught in the lies and greed of those who were supposed to be caring for her.(n)

programme.title: Don't Tell the Doctor
programme.desc: Four doctors attend a quartet of self-diagnosing young people. Dance teacher Ben has a bleeding rash all over his back, chest and neck, and made it worse by applying baking soda, while TV host and model Nicola's hair is falling out, convincing her she has a brain tumour. Plus, Dan, who has an uncontrollably itchy bottom and Toyin, who has risked her life with dodgy diet drugs.(n)

programme.title: Vacation
programme.desc: In this installment of the "Vacation" series, the youngest son of the Griswold clan, now grown with a family of his own, sets out to recreate a cross-country road trip from his youth to an amusement park(n)

programme.title: The Second Best Exotic Marigold Hotel
programme.desc: Sonny (Dev Patel) prepares to expand the Best Exotic Marigold Hotel for the Elderly and Beautiful while planning his impending wedding to Sunaina (Tena Desae) in this sequel that reteams director John Madden and screenwriter Ol Parker. As the contented residents of the hotel begin settling into their new lives, Sonny strives to balance the demands of planning his wedding with the responsibilities of purchasing a new property. Meanwhile, new guests Guy (Richard Gere) and Lavinia (Tamsin Greig) find themselves in a predicament after arriving at the hotel to find there is only one vacancy. Perhaps with a little innovation new co-manager Muriel (Maggie Smith) can find a means of accommodating the hotel's latest occupants, but she'll have her work cut out for her as Douglas (Bill Nighy) and Evelyn (Judi Dench) begin their new careers in Jaipur while flirting with the idea of a serious romance -- like Norman (Ronald Pickup) and Carol (Diana Hardcastle). With romance in the air it's no wonder that Madge (Celia Imrie) has her pick of handsome suitors, and as stalwart Muriel safeguards the many secrets of the vivacious residents, Sonny and Sunaina learn that planning a traditional Indian wedding can be a true test of commitment(n)

programme.title: Making of 'Me and Earl and the Dying Girl'
programme.desc: A look at the 2015 comedy-drama "Me and Earl and the Dying Girl," about a high-school student who befriends a classmate who has leukemia(n)

programme.title: The Rose

programme.title: True Story
programme.desc: In this psychological thriller based on actual events, a disgraced journalist plays a game of cat and mouse with an accused murderer who assumed his identity while on the run(n)

programme.title: The Sweetest Thing
programme.desc: Former South Park writer and Win Ben Stein's Money sidekick Nancy Pimental makes her feature screenwriting debut with this relationship comedy. Cameron Diaz stars as Christina Walters, a jaded, club-hopping single woman in Boston who has given up trying to find the perfect mate to focus on "Mr. Right Now." Her equally cynical friend, Courtney (Christina Applegate), a divorce attorney, shares much the same attitude. Christina's life changes forever one evening at a nightclub where she meets Peter Donahue (Thomas Jane), a man she finds adorable and just about perfect. Unfortunately, Peter disappears and all she knows about him is that his brother, Roger (Jason Bateman), is getting married soon and having a bachelor party nearby. When crashing the party doesn't pan out, Courtney suggests they road trip to the wedding and Christina agrees, leading to encounters with a series of obstacles, including some funky leftovers and an insane bank security guard. The Sweetest Thing co-stars Parker Posey and Selma Blair(n)

programme.title: I Love You, Man
programme.desc: On the verge of getting married, real estate agent Peter Klaven realises he doesn't have any close pals. Setting out to find a best man, he befriends amiable slacker Sydney Fife, but spends so much time with his new buddy that the wedding is put in jeopardy. Comedy(n)

programme.title: Leatherheads
programme.desc: A love triangle breaks out when a hard-drinking 1920s pro-football player signs an All-American college star and war hero to help his floundering franchise, and they both fall for a rookie reporter(n)

programme.title: Mission: Impossible II
programme.desc: Special agent Ethan Hunt is plunged into an international crisis. With computer genius Ving Rhames at his side and beautiful thief Thandie Newton on his mind, Hunt races across Australia and Spain on an impossible mission(n)

programme.title: Magnolia
programme.desc: Ensemble drama that follows the broken lives of several LA residents(n)

programme.title: Monster's Ball
programme.desc: Director Marc Forster, winner of Best Feature at Slamdance for his debut film Loungers (1996) and the "Someone to Watch" Independent Spirit Award for his indie drama Everything Put Together (2000), follows up those acclaimed projects with this intense, racially charged romance. Billy Bob Thornton stars as Georgia prison guard Hank Grotowski, a hard-drinking racist ex-cop whose father, Buck (Peter Boyle), is dying of emphysema and whose son, Sonny (Heath Ledger), works the execution detail at the prison's death row. When Sonny commits suicide, Hank is devastated and quits his job, spiraling into a deep depression until, one night, he comes to the aid of Leticia (Halle Berry), a beautiful African-American woman whose son, Tyrell (Coronji Calhoun), has been hit by a car. When Tyrell dies, Leticia and Hank find themselves to be unexpected soul mates linked together by tragic grief. It's not long before Hank discovers that Leticia is the widow of Lawrence Musgrove (Sean Combs), the man whose execution by electric chair he and his late son helped to orchestrate. Monster's Ball (2001) is based on a screenplay by actors Milo Addica and Will Rokos, who spent five years developing their script into a feature. Their title refers to the name of an English tradition requiring jailers to throw a party for a condemned man on the night before his death(n)

programme.title: Body of Lies
programme.desc: CIA agents Leonardo DiCaprio and Russell Crowe plot a terrorist deception in Ridley Scott's blistering spy thriller(n)

programme.title: Jem and the Holograms

programme.title: 27 Dresses
programme.desc: Wedding mania gets a comic spin in the tale of Jane (Katherine Heigl), who's always a bridesmaid and never a bride. Jane's passion for all things nuptial is tested when she's asked to plan her sister's wedding to the man she secretly loves. A cynical columnist (James Marsden) who falls for Jane while surreptitiously writing a human-interest story about her further complicates Jane's dreams of love and marriage(n)

programme.title: Le Divorce
programme.desc: James Ivory and Ismail Merchant's drama, written by Ruth Prawer Jhabvala, stars Kate Hudson, who flies to Paris to visit her pregnant stepsister Naomi Watts. However, her arrival coincides with Watts' husband walking out to live with his Russian mistress. Hudson, forced to stay in Paris, falls in love with the city and begins an ultimately unsatisfying adulterous affair with an older man, coldly observed by her employee Glenn Close, who also had an affair with Lhermitte(n)

programme.title: Scent of a Woman

programme.title: Ghost World

The film is based on the graphic novel by co-screenwriter Daniel Clowes. Scarlett Johansson, Brad Renfro, Illeana Douglas, Bob Balaban, Teri Garr(n)

programme.title: Frequency
programme.desc: An atmospheric phenomenon enables a New York police officer to communicate with his beloved dead father, a fire fighter and amateur radio enthusiast, across thirty years of time. He manages to warn his father of his own death, but by changing events in history they unwittingly cause a tragedy, and now need to try to alter history again(n)

programme.title: The Amityville Horror

Now, a year later, an unsuspecting young couple, George and Kathy Lutz, and their children move into the house that was the site of the horrific event and is now haunted by a murderous presence. What follows is 28 days of unimaginable terror. With demonic visions of the dead and relentless screams of terror, this is the haunted house story that isn't just a movie - it's real(n)

But he is saved from death, and must atone for his actions by becoming a guardian who banishes earthbound demons to Hell. When he meets a policewoman investigating the suspicious death of her sister, they are drawn into a desperate bid to save all humanity from evil(n)

Regular weekly features included "K9 Cops and Animal Heroes," "Celebrity Owners," and "Animal Bloopers." programme.title: M*A*S*H
programme.desc: The Interview. M*A*S*H digresses from its standard format in this episode, which originally closed out the series' fourth season. Filmed in black and white, the episode is staged in the form of an interview conducted for American television by visiting war correspondent Clete Roberts (playing himself). In a progression of largely improvised segments, the series' entire cast (with the exception of Loretta Swit) offer their views on the war, their work, and their hopes for the future. The most compelling moment occurs when Father Mulcahy (William Christopher), describing a macabre encounter with the wounded, burst into tears. The first of two such "documentary" episodes, The Interview was the final M*A*S*H effort overseen by writer-producer-director Larry Gelbart, who would soon leave the series(n)

programme.title: Play It to the Bone
programme.desc: Two fighters who never made it to the championships receive one final chance at glory in this boxing road movie. But their purse requires them to be ready to rumble in Vegas in less than five hours(n)

programme.title: Snow White: A Tale of Terror
programme.desc: A woman is consumed by hatred and jealousy of her stepdaughter, whom she blames for her own miscarriage. She has the girl driven into an inhospitable forest, where she is befriended by a band of treasure-hunters. But on learning she still lives, the wicked stepmother resorts to black magic to finish her off(n)

programme.title: Johnny Handsome
programme.desc: A physically deformed criminal is caught and nearly killed after being double-crossed by his partners. Offered cosmetic surgery to give him a fresh chance at life, he is tempted by revenge(n)

programme.title: Cheech and Chong's Next Movie
programme.desc: Richard Marin and Thomas Chong's misadventures as bumbling musicians(n)

programme.title: Captain Ron
programme.desc: Tempers run as high as the seas in this comedy of errors in which a stressed executive inherits a boat and takes his family cruising in the Caribbean. The vessel turns out to be a complete wreck, as does Captain Ron, the pilot hired to help them navigate. He has his own strange ideas about how the ship should be run(n)

programme.title: Executive Decision
programme.desc: Islamic terrorists take control of a Washington-bound jet. Intelligence analyst David tags along with the rescue team, and when the commando leader is killed, it's up to the desk jockey to save the passengers(n)

programme.title: Fire Down Below
programme.desc: Steven seagal plays an fbi agent who loses his friend to the hands of a corrupt toxic dump cover-up in Kentucky. He visits the town in question to try and uncover the truth(n)

programme.title: Body Parts
programme.desc: A psychologist (Jeff Fahey) injured in a car accident receives an arm transplant from a serial killer. Kim Delaney. Dr. Webb: Lindsay Duncan. Remo: Brad Dourif. Det. Sawchuk: Zakes Mokae. Mark: Paul Benvictor. Charlie: John Walsh. Directed by Eric Red(n)

programme.title: The Assassination of Jesse James by the Coward Robert Ford
programme.desc: Writer-director Andrew Dominik's thoughtful, elegiac saga is a dead-on throwback to classic Westerns of yore. Brad Pitt gives a bang-up performance as the notorious outlaw living out his final days in 1882 before being gunned down by a member of his gang (Casey Affleck). Features a cameo by political pundit James Carville as Governor Crittenden and rocker Nick Cave as a saloon singer. Cave also co-wrote the score. Actor-playwright Sam Shepard costars as Jesse's brother Frank(n)

programme.title: Platoon
programme.desc: This drama examines the fight between good and evil among an American infantry platoon in the jungles of Vietnam(n)

programme.title: Babylon A.D.
programme.desc: Vin Diesel stars in this sci-fi thriller about a mercenary who escorts a mysterious young woman with a deadly secret from post-apocalyptic Eastern Europe to New York City(n)

programme.title: The Bourne Ultimatum
programme.desc: Jason Bourne is on a quest to discover his true identity, and how he became a consummate killer, in the third entry of this series(n)

programme.title: Legend
programme.desc: This thriller follows the rise and fall of Ronald and Reginald Kray, identical twin gangsters who built a criminal empire in London during the 1950s and '60s(n)

programme.title: The Arrival
programme.desc: Astronomer Zane discovers an alien radio signal and when he tries to report it he unearths a sinister conspiracy(n)

programme.title: The Second Arrival
programme.desc: In this sci-fi adventure, a brave hero saves the Blue Planet from alien invaders and in so doing keeps a promise to his dead brother(n)

programme.title: Tron
programme.desc: Hacker Jeff Bridges is drawn into a computerised world where he must do battle with rogue programs in order to escape(n)

programme.title: Under Siege 2: Dark Territory
programme.desc: Action thriller starring Steven Seagal as a chef who gets caught up in the hijacking of a train. Casey Ryback used to be a Navy SEAL, but he left it all behind and opted for a quieter life in catering. However, when he accompanies his niece on a cross-country train trip Ryback little suspects that he is about to be plunged into another life-or-death situation. The train is about to be taken over by Travis Dane, a psychopathic criminal who needs it to help him gain control of a high-tech satellite which could create havoc on Earth if it fell into the wrong hands. Ryback is on the scene - but can he do anything to stop Dane before it is too late?(n)

programme.title: Tango & Cash
programme.desc: Ray Tango and Gabriel Cash are two of LA's finest cops who can't stand each other but when they're wrongfully imprisoned the pair must work together to clear their names and bring down the people responsible(n)

programme.title: Ocean's Thirteen
programme.desc: Thirteen is the new twelve in the third terrific chapter of Oscar® winners George Clooney and Steven Soderbergh's criminal caper series. With a stellar cast of criminal cohorts, it doesn't matter if it's eleven, twelve or thirteen -- it all adds up to fun. So ... are you in or are you out?(n)

programme.title: Scarface
programme.desc: Widely-celebrated modern-day classic of the gangster genre. Al Pacino delivers an unforgettable performance as Cuban immigrant Tony Montana as he climbs his way up through the American underworld. Based on the Howard Hawk's original movie in 1932 and boasting a screenplay from Oliver Stone(n)

programme.title: Dark Water
programme.desc: Dahlia and daughter Ceci are happy in their New York apartment until stagnant water begins to seep through the roof. Is someone - or something - living upstairs? Psychological horror from the author of The Ring(n)

programme.title: Transformers: Revenge of the Fallen
programme.desc: Director Michael Bay returns with his second instalment of the sci-fi action romp that pits humans against some big, bad (very bad) alien robots, the Decepticons. In this sequel, which manages to be even louder and more prone to explosions than the initial outing, Sam Witwicky and his girlfriend Mikaela Banes are once more at the centre of the action. Witwicky is being hunted down by the Decepticons, who recognise that he is their main impediment to their gaining control of an awesome source of energy. As the Decepticons' plan would result in the destruction of the Sun, mankind's fate rests on the shoulders (and in the ingenuity) of our oddly named hero... Edited for language and violence(n)

programme.title: The X-Files: I Want to Believe
programme.desc: Agents Mulder and Scully return to the world of the weird and unexplained. But do they still have what it takes to solve this new paranormal case?(n)

programme.title: MI-5
programme.desc: When head of counter-terrorism, Harry Pearce, goes missing, his apprentice Will Holloway sets off to find out what happened. With an impending attack on London looming and Holloway discovering a conspiracy running from Vietnam to the Mediterranean, he is on a race with time and must solve the case before it's too late(n)

programme.title: Gone in 60 Seconds
programme.desc: Tense thriller in which a car thief is forced to steal 50 luxury vehicles in one night in order to save the life of his brother, who has fallen foul of a dangerous crime lord. Once the most successful car thief in California, he must reassemble his old gang to fulfil the almost impossible mission. His task is further hampered by a rival band of thieves and, of course, the local police(n)

programme.title: Forbidden History
programme.sub-title: The Man In The Iron Mask
programme.desc: The Man In The Iron Mask. A notorious prisoner in 17th-century France known as "The Man in the Iron Mask" is profiled(n)

programme.title: Myth Hunters
programme.sub-title: The Men Who Found the Maya
programme.desc: The Men Who Found the Maya. A 19th-century expedition to uncover the secrets of the Maya civilization by two amateur adventurers is recalled(n)

programme.title: Forbidden History
programme.sub-title: In Search of the Real King Arthur
programme.desc: In Search of the Real King Arthur. In Search of the Real King Arthur. Knights, castles and round tables are all part of the enduring King Arthur legend. Is there any truth to it? Hear the various claims to his origins(n)

programme.title: America: Facts vs. Fiction
programme.desc: The New World. A look at Christopher Columbus' journeys; and Hernán Cortés' conflict with the Aztec empire(n)

programme.title: Babe Winkelman's Good Fishing
programme.desc: Big Water Smallmouth Boom. Smallmouth bass fishing on the open water of Mille Lacs Lake in central Minnesota; insight on how Babe rigs his boat; and wild mushroom picking close to home(n)

programme.title: CIA Declassified
programme.desc: Argo: The Secret Story. U.S. diplomats in Iran pose as a Canadian film crew to escape the 1979 hostage crisis(n)

programme.title: CIA Declassified
programme.desc: The Beirut Bomb. In 1985, CIA director William Casey allegedly ordered the killing of a Lebanese cleric who he thought was the head of militant group Hezbollah(n)

programme.title: CIA Declassified
programme.desc: The Real Zero Dark Thirty. The hunt for Osama bin Laden is examined(n)

programme.title: Nazi Secret Files
programme.desc: Nazi Death Ray. Uncovering hitherto secret files and showcasing the latest analytical research that is revolutionising the view of World War II - exposing the bizarre beliefs and reckless actions behind the Nazi's bid for global domination(n)

programme.title: Hitler and the Aryan Myth
programme.desc: The mystic roots of Nazism and how they were used to justify atrocities are examined(n)

programme.title: Nazi Secret Files
programme.desc: Nazi Killer Bugs. Biological-weapon research is conducted by the Nazis to be used against the Allies during World War II(n)

programme.title: Nazi Secret Files
programme.desc: Hitler's Messiah Complex. Adolf Hitler's religious delusions and their origins are examined(n)

programme.title: Inside Secret Societies
programme.desc: The Yakuza. Crime syndicates in Japan that are engaged in extortion, prostitution and illegal gambling are examined(n)

programme.title: Inside Secret Societies
programme.desc: The KKK. A look at the Ku Klux Klan includes a history of the white supremacist group, founded in the 1860s after the U.S. Civil War, and interviews with members(n)

programme.title: Inside Secret Societies
programme.desc: The Priory of Sion. A secret about Jesus Christ is allegedly protected by an organization with roots in the 12th century(n)

programme.title: Inside Secret Societies
programme.desc: The Brotherhood of the Blood. Protecting Christ's blood is the sworn mission of an ancient and mysterious group(n)

programme.title: WWII in the Pacific
programme.desc: Waking the Beast. Japan's surprise attack on Pearl Harbor on Dec. 7, 1941, is featured in the premiere of this series examining air, land and sea battles in the Pacific Ocean during World War II(n)

programme.title: WWII in the Pacific
programme.desc: Island Warfare. The summer of 1942 finds the U.S. and its allies gaining the upper hand by achieving naval superiority, but by the spring of 1945 Japan refuses to surrender(n)

programme.title: How We Got Here
programme.desc: Colt Makes All Men Equal. A profile of inventor Samuel Colt and how his marketing strategy for the famous revolver paved the way for U.S. manufacturing might(n)

programme.title: How We Got Here
programme.desc: Morse Code Connects Us All. Long-distance communication becomes an obsession for painter Samuel Morse (1791-1872) after the sudden death of his wife(n)

programme.title: How We Got Here
programme.sub-title: Nazis Get Us to the Moon
programme.desc: Nazis Get Us to the Moon. A series examining entrepreneurship and technological advances in the U.S. begins with a profile of Nazi rocket scientist Wernher Von Braun and a look at how he helped shape America's space program in the mid-20th century(n)

programme.title: How We Got Here

programme.title: Mary Berry Everyday
programme.desc: The food writer and former Great British Bake Off judge celebrates the everyday food and ingredients she has always loved, from hearty and wholesome ideas to dishes that are a little bit more indulgent. Mary begins by travelling to Scotland to enjoy the best of the country's staple foods, preparing recipes inspired by her own Scots heritage. She discovers wonderful shellfish in Ullapool, joins chef Tom Kitchin to share the joy of venison cooked on a barbecue and whips up her special whisky cream on the banks of a loch.(n)

programme.title: My Life
programme.sub-title: My Life: The Boy on the Bicycle.
programme.desc: A guided tour by 16-year-old Syrian boy, Ahmed, through one of the biggest refugee camps in the world - Zaatari in Jordan. Ahmed is like any other boy his age, except he's had to leave everything behind, including his toys and technology, to move to the refugee camp. Life in Zaatari is nothing compared to home. When the Syrian civil war began in 2012 his family had to abandon their affluent lives and flee across the border to Zaatari camp with thousands of others for safety. Now living in a storage container for a home after his house was destroyed in the civil war, he has lived in Zaatari for three years, along with 80,000 other refugees, who can't leave the camp without permission. Despite their camp having everything they need, from shops to a hospital, school and football pitches, life is very different to how it was before. Ahmed doesn't let this affect his positivity though, and he finds new ways to have fun with his friends - even if it is in a desert sandstorm followed by flooding. As Ahmed cycles around the five mile square camp he introduces some of the other inspirational children who live there and reveals the reality of life in a refugee camp from a child's unique point of view.(n)

programme.title: Monsters vs Aliens
programme.desc: A woman is exposed to radiation from a meteorite that causes her to grow to an enormous size during her wedding. She is captured by the military and held prisoner with an assortment of strange creatures - but when aliens invade, these freaks of nature are the only ones capable of saving the world. Animated sci-fi comedy, with the voices of Reese Witherspoon and Hugh Laurie.(n)

programme.title: Pointless Celebrities
programme.desc: Alexander Armstrong and Richard Osman present another edition of the unorthodox game show, inviting stars from the world of TV comedy to put their general knowledge to the test. The contestant duos are former TV to Go co-stars Hugh Dennis and Pauline McLynn, comedy writer Charlie Higson and Citizen Khan actor Adil Ray, ex-'Allo 'Allo stars Richard Gibson and Vicki Michelle, and Last of the Summer Wine's Jean Fergusson, who teams up with Tina Malone - better known as Shameless's Mimi Maguire.(n)

programme.title: Let's Sing and Dance for Comic Relief
programme.desc: New series. Presenter double-team Mel Giedroyc and Sue Perkins are reunited to host the all-star talent show, in which celebrity performers take to the stage to display their musical talents by delivering their interpretations of various pop hits. The contest gets under way with performances by Radio 1 DJ Matt Edmondson, astrologer Russell Grant, comedienne Sara Pascoe, DJ duo Rickie Haywood-Williams and Melvin Odoom, and Absolutely Fabulous actresses Harriet Thorpe and Helen Lederer - otherwise known as Patsy's long-suffering associates Fleur and Catriona. Only two of the star acts featured each week will be able progress to the Grand Final, with today's guest panellists Paul O'Grady, Jo Brand and Frank Skinner deciding each star's fate.(n)

programme.title: Who Dares Wins
programme.desc: Game show in which Nick Knowles challenges two pairs of complete strangers to team up, with each pair battling to outdo the other by listing as much as they know about a given subject. The first couple to win two rounds get to play for £50,000 and each time the champions defeat a new set of opponents their winnings mount up.(n)

programme.title: Casualty
programme.desc: David prepares to hand Ollie over to his aunt, who will be taking him back to Rosa in Spain. With their separation imminent, father and son spend one last day together - in the ER. Iain suspects Gem is up to her old tricks when she short-changes a customer at the coffee shop, and Dylan presents himself to the board to pitch an idea to raise awareness of alcohol abuse. However, when his presentation fails to hit the mark, Louise takes matters into her own hands, and drags the board members into the corridors of the ER to witness firsthand the pressure binge drinkers are placing on the hospital's resources.(n)

programme.title: Mrs Brown's Boys
programme.desc: A secretive phone call from a solicitor to Mrs Brown leaves her children suspecting one of them may be adopted, while Father Quinn returns from rehab and asks Agnes to help out at his annual garden party - although as she proceeds to drive him crazy with a smartphone, his recovery may be short-lived. Meanwhile, Cathy receives a blast from the past, Rory and Dino have a bust-up, and Mark and Betty deliver bad news - they are leaving for Australia right away. Domestic comedy, starring Brendan O'Carroll.(n)

programme.title: Match of the Day
programme.desc: Gary Lineker presents highlights of the latest Premier League matches, including Leicester City v Hull City at King Power Stadium, and Liverpool v Arsenal at Anfield. The Foxes find themselves mired in a relegation battle for the second time in three seasons, and faced a tricky fixture at home to the similarly-threatened Tigers, who have shown signs of improvement under Marco Silva. At the other end of the table, The Reds and The Gunners faced each other knowing that a loss would all but end their dwindling hopes of winning this year's title.(n)

programme.title: This Country
programme.desc: Kerry becomes a door-to-door saleswoman and Kurtan makes new friends in the village. Mockumentary presenting a wry look at the lives of young people living in modern, rural Britain.(n)

programme.desc: A Greek millionaire loses everything he has in a financial crisis, leaving him with only one asset - his share in the fish and chip shop his father used to run. He is forced to return to his roots and work with his laidback brother to revive the family business. Comedy, starring Stephen Dillane, Georgia Groome and Georges Corraface.(n)

Having recently lost an incredible 16 stone between them, newly found confidence has led to a shopping obsession, each of them buying new clothes to flatter their new frames. Plus, Alex visits British lingerie brand Rigby and Peller to find out what we should be looking for when it comes to bras.(n)

programme.desc: Mariella Frostrup and Richard Coles present the show from the National Portrait Gallery, where the artists face two of their hardest challenges. Firstly, they have to produce a self-portrait, most of which seem to capture the subject looking afraid. They are then joined by sitters Angela Rippon and Floella Benjamin and challenged to capture their famous faces accurately on canvas.(n)

programme.title: Countryfile

Tom Heap travels to Spain to get to the bottom of Britain's vegetable crisis, and Adam Henson investigates new ways to stop cattle from roaming.(n)

programme.title: Call the Midwife
programme.desc: Dr Turner is reunited with a couple whose daughter was born without limbs, and takes them to a specialist unit where she can be fitted for prosthetics. However, while the experience helps the girl's mother to realise that she is not alone, it proves traumatic for the father, who blames his wife for his child's condition. Nurse Crane takes charge of Sister Winifred's driving lessons, and Trixie thinks Christopher is hiding something from her.(n)

programme.title: SS-GB
programme.desc: Archer tracks down Spode, who confesses to murdering his brother before taking his own life, leaving Huth furious. As the resistance and the German form an alliance to free the King from imprisonment, Archer's priority is recovering the atomic bomb documents. A roll of film found on Spode's person appears to contain the missing calculations, but further investigations prove dangerous when Archer comes under attack from the rebels, narrowly surviving an attack on the Underground and a bombing at Highgate cemetery.(n)

programme.title: Natural World
programme.sub-title: Ireland's Wild River: The Mighty Shannon - Natural World.
programme.desc: The Shannon, which runs through the heart of Ireland, is the longest river in the British Isles. For locally born naturalist and cameraman Colin Stafford-Johnson, it is also the wildest. Here Colin paddles along the Shannon to reveal the creatures living in the water and along the banks, such as kingfishers, predatory pike and native red squirrels.(n)

programme.desc: Dion Dublin and Martin Roberts visit semi-detached properties in the Midlands, while Lucy Alexander heads to Kilburn in north-west London to view a flat with a bad case of damp.(n)

programme.title: Two Greedy Italians
programme.sub-title: Two Greedy Italians: Still Hungry: Liguria and la Bella Figura.
programme.desc: Antonio Carluccio and Gennaro Contaldo search for the meaning of the Italian phrase `la bella figura' - making the best of yourself. They find a culture of admiration for the superficial in Portofino and set off around the coastal Liguria region in search of something more meaningful, and find what they are looking for in a priest working with social outcasts. Along the way they discover a 50 euro olive oil and the Cucina Bianca of Mendatica.(n)

programme.title: The Little Paris Kitchen: Cooking with Rachel Khoo
programme.desc: The pastry chef puts her own twist on the French dish cassoulet, and prepares an unusual cake made from pistachio and goat's cheese. She also visits an award-winning cheese shop and heads to the world's largest wholesale food market in Rungis to produce steak tartare for a group of local butchers.(n)

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: Jules Hudson helps a couple, who have returned to the UK after living abroad for 13 years, find their dream home in rural Oxfordshire on a budget of up to £1million. Away from the property search, the presenter learns how to make a famous British accessory.(n)

programme.title: Mastermind
programme.desc: John Humphrys introduces the 2017 final of the specialist and general knowledge quiz in which six contestants brave the black chair to win the coveted Mastermind trophy in a bumper one-hour edition. The specialised subjects the films of Alfred Hitchcock, the history of Leningrad, the life and films of Billy Wilder, TV comedy Seinfeld, architect Inigo Jones and the short films of Laurel and Hardy. Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: University Challenge
programme.desc: The quarter-finals continue, with two teams of four students battling it out to make it to the next stage of the competition as they try to win two matches and progress to the semi-finals. Jeremy Paxman asks the questions.(n)

programme.title: Only Connect
programme.desc: Victoria Coren Mitchell hosts as the Psmiths take on the Cosmopolitans in this quarter-final match. Contenders must use patience, lateral thinking and sheer inspiration to make connections between groups of four things that may appear at first not to be linked, with one set of clues consisting of Ali Amako, Reece Thens, Elize Elmopan and Enya Airobi.(n)

programme.title: Live Athletics
programme.sub-title: Live Athletics: European Indoor Championships: 2017 Day Two: Evening Session.
programme.desc: Gabby Logan presents coverage of the evening session on day two from the Kombank Arena in Belgrade, Serbia, where medals are awarded in 10 events. On the track, gold medalists will be crowned in the women's and men's 400m and 1500m, along with the men's 60m, while the winners of the women's high jump, triple jump and pole vault will be decided, as they will be in the men's shot put and long jump. With commentary and analysis from Steve Backley, Steve Cram, Colin Jackson, Denise Lewis and Paula Radcliffe. Coverage continues on the interactive service.(n)

programme.title: Grand Tours of the Scottish Islands
programme.sub-title: Against the Odds: Out Skerries, Whalsay and Papa Stour.
programme.desc: Paul Murton visits the three island outposts of Shetland, Papa Stour, Whalsay and Out Skerries. He encounters newborn lambs and watches a traditional sword dance, before taking a trip on a trawler. He discovers how the islands have developed their own sense of community in the face of declining populations and the challenges of a remote location.(n)

programme.title: Dad's Army
programme.desc: Sgt Wilson struggles to concentrate on his Home Guard duties when he has a personal problem to contend with. Classic comedy, starring John Le Mesurier and Arthur Lowe.(n)

programme.title: Live at the Apollo
programme.desc: Adam Hills, host of Channel 4's The Last Leg, is the latest master of ceremonies at London's Hammersmith Apollo. He introduces US comic Michelle Wolf and sharp-witted Jamali Maddix to the stage.(n)

programme.title: Artsnight
programme.desc: Film critic Nick James interviews the Academy Award-winning director, in a conversation recorded at London's British Film Institute. Scorsese's most acclaimed films include the likes of Taxi Driver, Raging Bull, Goodfellas, Gangs of New York and The Departed, and many of them focus on themes of masculinity, religion, crime, and life in New York. James quizzes the director on his fascination with these subjects, and his success at deconstructing them on film.(n)

programme.title: Mean Streets
programme.desc: A small-time crook collecting protection money for his gangster uncle hopes to rise in the world of organised crime, but he is troubled by his conscience and loyalty to his girlfriend. As penance, he takes it upon himself to control a trouble-making friend's self-destructive impulses. Martin Scorsese's drama, starring Robert De Niro, Harvey Keitel, Amy Robinson, Robert Romanus and Victor Argo.(n)

programme.title: Taboo
programme.desc: James Delaney's shocking return to London society has set tongues wagging, but the swarthy adventurer's mission is far from complete. The city's residents view him with hostility and suspicion, but undeterred by their derision, James begins to enlist allies in his quest to reclaim his legacy and establish a new life for himself. However, an unexpected arrival at the reading of his father's will threatens to disrupt James's plans, and the true, poisonous nature of his new-found inheritance makes itself known. Historical drama, starring Tom Hardy.(n)

programme.title: Taboo
programme.desc: James Delaney finds himself alone with the mysterious Dr Dumbarton, and ends up discovering he has an unlikely ally. However, with enemies lurking in every corner of London society, James realises Dumbarton's friendship will be but the first in a series of perilous affiliations he will need to make if he is to complete his mission - or avoid meeting an untimely fate. As he works to prevent further attempts on his life, James realises the only way to slip the gaze of his enemies is to give them a more pliable target to destroy in his place. Historical drama, starring Tom Hardy.(n)

programme.title: Witchfinder General
programme.desc: A lawyer callously destroys innocent lives while performing his duties as a witchfinder, earning a terrifying reputation for brutality and injustice. However, he meets his match in a courageous soldier seeking revenge on the man for having raped his betrothed. Michael Reeves' 17th-century period horror, with Vincent Price, Ian Ogilvy, Rupert Davies, Patrick Wymark and Hilary Dwyer.(n)

programme.title: This Is BBC Two
programme.desc: Preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two.(n)

programme.title: A to Z of TV Gardening
programme.desc: Carol Kirkwood looks at themes beginning with the letter E, as part of her alphabetical journey through the world of horticulture. Along the way, she gets inspiration and advice from some of the BBC's most popular gardening presenters.(n)

programme.title: An Island Parish
programme.desc: The documentary returns with more tales chronicling life on Sark in the Channel Islands, beginning with the residents making preparations for Christmas. Julie installs lifesize handmade elves in her shop, fisherman Baz Adams distributes vast quantities of mistletoe and Methodist lay preacher Karen Le Mouton calls in some help for a special service.(n)

programme.title: Around the World in 80 Gardens
programme.desc: Monty Don heads to India, where he takes in some of the most masterful examples of horticultural and architectural extravagance in the world - including the gardens of the Taj Mahal. Along the way, the green-fingered presenter investigates the majestic tomb gardens of the Mughal emperors, and a unique rock sculpture garden created from discarded objects and rubbish.(n)

programme.title: Countryfile
programme.desc: Matt Baker and Ellie Harrison present the show from the Isle of Man. Matt takes a ride on the world's only remaining horse-drawn tram, while Ellie explores the ruins of ancient homesteads from the island's agricultural past and bakes bread using traditional Manx methods. Adam Henson trains a new working dog for his farm and Tom Heap reports on the banning of second homes in Cornwall.(n)

programme.title: Saturday Kitchen Best Bites
programme.desc: Matt Tebbutt presents highlights of the series, recalling his favourite moments from previous years in the kitchen.(n)

programme.title: Nigel Slater's Dish of the Day
programme.desc: The food writer turns the contents of his weekly shop into seven more meals, showing how to make ingredients go further - from getting the most out of a cut of ribs to using every last vegetable peeling. Dishes include butternut squash soup with crisps, rib ragout and cherry chocolate iced rice.(n)

programme.title: Nigellissima
programme.desc: Nigella Lawson treats her supper guests to a feast of lamb chops with mint, chilli and potatoes, served alongside roasted red onions with fennel and basil. Dessert is a true Anglo-Italian affair with a plum and amaretti crumble. There are also recipes for farro risotto with mushrooms, and chocolate pasta with a dark butterscotch sauce. Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: MOTD2 Extra
programme.desc: Mark Chapman presents football discussion with a line-up of guests, focusing on the headlines from yesterday's matches and news ahead of today's fixtures.(n)

programme.title: Triathlon
programme.sub-title: 2017 ITU World Triathlon Series: Abu Dhabi.
programme.desc: Highlights of the opening round of the ITU World Triathlon Series from Abu Dhabi in United Arab Emirates, featuring the men's and women's races.(n)

programme.title: Live Athletics
programme.sub-title: Live Athletics: European Indoor Championships: 2017 Day Three.
programme.desc: Gabby Logan presents coverage of the third and final day from the Kombank Arena in Belgrade, Serbia, where medals are awarded in 11 events. The finals of the women's and men's 800m, 3,000m and 4x400m relay will all take place on this concluding day, in addition to the women's 60m and long jump, plus the men's high jump and triple jump, and the conclusion of the heptathlon. With commentary and analysis from Steve Backley, Steve Cram, Colin Jackson, Denise Lewis and Paula Radcliffe.(n)

programme.title: Robot Wars
programme.desc: New series. Dara O Briain and Angela Scanlon present the first group heat, with eight teams facing off through two group battles in the arena for a place in the grand final. A new twist on the format sees random house robots being sent to attack the competitors if they stray into the wrong part of the arena. Jonathan Pearce commentates on the action, while Professor Noel Sharkey, Dr Lucy Rogers and Professor Sethu Vijayakumar judge the operators' skills and select a victor in the case of an uncertain outcome.(n)

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Chris Harris test-drives the Ferrari FXXK at the Daytona circuit in Florida and is joined by Matt LeBlanc and Rory Reid to race across Kazakhstan in three high-mileage cars - a Mercedes saloon, a Volvo estate and a London taxi. Actor James McAvoy guest stars in the studio and on the famous Top Gear test track.(n)

programme.title: Special Forces - Ultimate Hell Week
programme.desc: The seven remaining contestants arrive in Australia for the final challenge, where they undergo training with the Special Air Service Regiment - but must first undergo a gruelling exercise to see if they are physically prepared for what is to come. Those that make it through this stage face tactical interrogation and an endurance race wearing weighted rucksacks. Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: London Road
programme.desc: Premiere. Fact-based musical, exploring the murders of five women in Ipswich in 2006, and the subsequent conviction of local man Steve Wright for the crimes. The film takes personal accounts of the victims, the murders and the aftermath from people living in the area and sets their exact words to music. Starring Olivia Colman and Tom Hardy.(n)

programme.title: Papillon
programme.desc: Fact-based drama about a Frenchman wrongly imprisoned for life for a crime he did not commit, who made an extraordinarily courageous bid to escape from the notorious Devil's Island - a former leper colony turned into a maximum-security prison. Starring Steve McQueen, Dustin Hoffman, Anthony Zerbe, Don Gordon and George Coulouris.(n)

programme.title: Indian Hill Railways
programme.desc: Workers on the railway at Shimla, once the summer capital during the days of the Raj, play a waiting game. Stationmaster Sanjay hopes for a promotion, his boss Bataljit expects a transfer, while teacher John Whitmarsh-Knight is searching for a home - and every one of them is anticipating snow. Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: She-Wolves: England's Early Queens
programme.desc: Helen Castor explores the role of queens in medieval and Tudor England, analysing how they evolved from being the wives of kings to powerful figures in their own right - but faced great struggles to impose their authority in a male-dominated society. She begins by recalling the life of Matilda, the daughter of Henry I, who waged war against her cousin Stephen in the mid-12th century in a bid to be recognised as her father's rightful successor. The historian also charts the turbulent life of Eleanor of Aquitaine, the wife of Henry II, who played a major role in governing England during the latter half of the 12th century.(n)

programme.title: Follow the Money
programme.desc: New series. Mads is intrigued by the seemingly trivial case of a small carpentry business that has gone bankrupt under mysterious circumstances. Claudia is released after 18 months in prison and receives a visit from Energreen's old chairman Mr Christensen, while Nicky has become an apprentice to the Swede 'P'. Danish crime thriller, starring Thomas Bo Larsen.(n)

programme.title: Follow the Money
programme.desc: Mads has to defend the police's handling of the hostage crisis in Nova Bank and digs deeper to find that the bank forced the carpenter into bankruptcy. Claudia has her first day at Absalon Bank, while P is still in the hospital and needs Nicky to take over his tasks. In Danish.(n)

programme.title: Top of the Pops: 1983
programme.desc: Gary Davies and Andy Peebles present music from April 14, including Eurythmics, Kajagoogoo, Bauhaus, Kissing the Pink, Sunfire, David Bowie and Sweet Dreams.(n)

programme.title: Top of the Pops: 1983
programme.desc: Richard Skinner and Janice Long introduce performances by Culture Club, the Human League, FR David, Twisted Sister, Toto, Heaven 17, Thompson Twins, Spandau Ballet and David Bowie.(n)

programme.title: The Secret Science of Pop
programme.desc: Evolutionary biologist Professor Armand Leroi gathers a team of scientists and researchers to analyse more than 50 years of UK chart music. When the results are in, Armand teams up with producer Trevor Horn. Using machine-learning techniques, they try to take a song by unsigned artist Nike Jemiyo and turn it into a potential chart-topper.(n)

programme.title: Janis: Little Girl Blue
programme.desc: Janis Joplin's powerful, soulful voice blazed new creative trails before her untimely death in 1970, aged 27. As director Amy Berg's documentary reveals Joplin's on-stage bravado and uninhibited sexual persona hid hurt and insecurity stemming from her childhood. On relocating from Texas to San Francisco and discovering the blues, she found an outlet for her loneliness and fell into a community that embraced and celebrated her talent. This retrospective includes some of Joplin's most iconic performances, which embodied the musical and cultural revolution of the 1960s. Narrated by Cat Power.(n)

programme.title: Queens of Soul
programme.desc: A compilation of archive footage to celebrate the critically-acclaimed female singers whose voices have come to define the soul genre, including Aretha Franklin, Roberta Flack, Gladys Knight, Randy Crawford, Angie Stone, Mary J Blige and Beyonce.(n)

programme.title: Sound of Song
programme.sub-title: Mix It Up and Start Again.
programme.desc: As his exploration of great songs reaches the modern era, Neil Brand charts how the arrival of digital technology and the computer transformed music. He talks synthesisers with Yes keyboardist Rick Wakeman, discusses sampling with Public Enemy's chief producer Hank Shocklee, uncovers the surprising lo-fi origins of Bruce Springsteen's Born in the USA, and finds out how Cher changed her voice on the smash hit Believe. Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: Kiri Te Kanawa at the BBC
programme.desc: Highlights of the soprano's career, over the past 40 years. The programme showcases memorable performances, including the Last Night of the Proms, the Royal Opera's production of Puccini's Manon, and singing rugby union anthem World in Union on Top of the Pops. Plus, chat show appearances and documentary footage in which the singer returns to her roots in New Zealand and discusses performing at a royal wedding in 1981.(n)

programme.title: The Hunt
programme.desc: Premiere. A teacher beginning to get his life back in order following his divorce faces losing everything when one of his pupils falsely accuses him of molesting her. Unable to provide evidence of his innocence, he finds the residents of a community he has lived in all his life swiftly turning against him. Drama, starring Mads Mikkelsen and Thomas Bo Larsen. In Danish and English.(n)

programme.title: Sound Waves: The Symphony of Physics
programme.desc: Helen Czerski investigates the science behind familiar sounds as well as those humans cannot hear. At the Palace of Westminster, she teams up with scientists to carry out measurements using state-of-the-art lasers to reveal how Big Ben vibrates to create pressure waves in the air at particular frequencies. She also explores the science of the voice, inviting soprano Lesley Garrett to sing I Dreamed A Dream inside an MRI scanner to reveal how her vocal tract acts as a resonator, amplifying and shaping the sound from her larynx.(n)

programme.title: Every Breath We Take: Understanding Our Atmosphere
programme.desc: Science writer Gabrielle Walker reveals how humanity has acquired an ever-greater understanding of air, upon which its life depends. By tracing the development of early scientific studies into the natural world, the presenter reveals how people came to appreciate that plants are supported by carbon dioxide, nitrogen enriches the soil, and oxygen gives people the energy they need to stay alive.(n)

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series
programme.desc: Chaotic cartoon capers following the further adventures of the popular halfwit immortalised in the live-action TV series and Hollywood films. With the voice of Rowan Atkinson.(n)

programme.desc: To celebrate the Dragon New Year, Bad Jack plans to throw Henri and Jimmy into a bottomless pit.(n)

programme.title: Be Cool, Scooby-Doo
programme.desc: Monsters and ghouls get in the way of the Scooby gang's adventures as they travel and spend time together in the summer.(n)

programme.title: The Tom & Jerry Show

programme.title: Tom & Jerry: Robin Hood and His Merry Mouse
programme.desc: The plucky mouse helps the legendary outlaw and his merry men in robbing from the rich to feed the poor. Evil King John to seek some feline assistance in putting a stop to his heroics - but the natural enemies are soon forced to work together. Animated comedy, with the voices of Jamie Bamber and Charles Shaughnessy.(n)

programme.title: Oddbods

programme.desc: The team is called to the home of a bomb disposal expert who shot and killed an intruder during a robbery. Crime drama, starring Mark Harmon and Michael Weatherly.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: The team becomes involved in an international incident when the body of an American petty officer is found by an estate agent in a bungalow that has been repossessed. An indentation on the victim's skull leads the agents to believe he was killed on a British ship, but collecting evidence from the vessel proves challenging. Guest starring Tracy Middendorf, Daniel Gillies and Kristen Ariza.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: The team investigates the deaths of a radio DJ and a naval officer who were both killed during a live broadcast, only to discover there are a number of potential suspects. Evidence leads the agents to suspect the involvement of a radical group called Military at Home, prompting Tony to investigate an upmarket gated community - where his door-to-door inquiries yield an enticing proposition or two from the female residents. American drama, starring Michael Weatherly, with Nadia Bjorlin.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: Abby becomes personally involved in the case of a murdered naval scientist who she regards as a kindred spirit. The team's initial inquiries turn up little concrete information about the victim's life, but the forensic specialist makes a breakthrough when she decodes some of the mysterious markings covering the body. Drama, starring Mark Harmon and Pauley Perrette.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: The team members are surprised when Gibbs asks DiNozzo's father to join them in their investigation of a murder committed at the US Naval Academy. Guest starring Robert Wagner.(n)

programme.desc: Thanksgiving celebrations in Colorado Springs are threatened by a severe drought and Jake and Loren's efforts to help by stealing water from the Native Americans' secret supply only serve to endanger their neighbours' lives. programme.title: NCIS

The duo single out three suspects, but learn vital information has been stolen, and realise the whole Persian Gulf Fleet could be in danger.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: A lieutenant apparently commits suicide by jumping from an aircraft carrier and Ziva and McGee are dispatched to inform the widow - but arrive to find that she has been killed. Subsequent inquiries reveal that the injuries on her body were inflicted after death and the murder scene was carefully staged to mislead investigators. Crime drama, starring Mark Harmon and Cote de Pablo.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: Gibbs receives a call from his old friend Senator Patrick Kiley, who claims he is being framed for the murder of a naval commander, and seeks help to clear his name. However, incriminating evidence quickly piles up against him - and a second death complicates matters further. Meanwhile, Ziva lets her hair down to obtain fingerprints from a big oil lobbyist. Crime drama, starring Mark Harmon.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: Gibbs revisits his home town to investigate an assault that left one marine dead and another badly injured, and enlists the help of his estranged father to identify the assailant. Suspicion initially falls on a local man whose daughter was dating the survivor of the attack - but later inquiries uncover a tangled tale of uncertain paternity and forbidden love. Crime drama, starring Mark Harmon and Ralph Waite.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: A marine is found murdered in his garage, and inquiries lead the agents to his former sergeant. However, Gibbs and the team soon find out that their man is under FBI witness protection as he is about to testify against a mobster, giving him a cast-iron alibi. Crime drama, starring Mark Harmon and Joe Spano.(n)

programme.title: Benefits Britain: Life on the Dole
programme.desc: Documentary following the inhabitants of the seaside village of Jaywick in Essex, where more than half of the residents are on state welfare. Twentysomethings Danielle and her boyfriend Josh are unable to work due to anxiety and depression and have moved to Blackpool to make a new start. However, with four children between them from previous relationships and another on the way they are struggling to make ends meet on a joint benefits income of around £100 a week.(n)

programme.title: Benefits Britain: Life on the Dole

After a failed attempt to start her own business in Australia, Kit is back in her home town of Wishaw, North Lanarkshire, to sign on and stay with friends, while Stirling resident Kirsty is desperate for work and is convinced her weight and mild learning disability are stopping her from getting a job.
