programme.desc: A flying saucer crashes on Farmer Yumi's land, and the pups help the pilot to return to his own planet.(n)

programme.title: Blaze and the Monster Machines
programme.desc: Stripes spots a small fire beetle that is lost in the jungle, so Blaze and his friends set out to help the insect return to his home - at the top of an active volcano.(n)

programme.title: Noddy: Toyland Detective
programme.sub-title: Noddy and the Case of Deltoid's Strange Behaviour.
programme.desc: Smartysaurus is upset because her best friend Deltoid keeps running away from her, so Noddy tries to get to the bottom of the mystery.(n)

programme.title: Ben and Holly's Little Kingdom
programme.desc: The friends go on a snail trek with Miss Jolly, which goes well until the snails head toward the Elf Farm and Mr Elf's cabbages.(n)

programme.title: Shimmer and Shine
programme.desc: Leah needs the genies' help when her bucket floats out to sea - which leads to a magical treasure hunt involving a talking parrot and a pirate ship.(n)

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: Peppa thinks she might need glasses, so Mummy Pig takes her to the optician.(n)

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: Daddy Pig's car runs out of petrol, leaving him stranded.(n)

programme.title: Ben and Holly's Little Kingdom
programme.desc: Captain Squid leaves a treasure map in the Little Kingdom, so Redbeard leads Ben, Holly and Nanny Plum on a search for the valuable item, which is located deep underwater.(n)

programme.title: Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles
programme.desc: The heroes end up in a parallel universe and must join forces with an alternate version of themselves to save both worlds.(n)

programme.title: Football on 5: The Championship
programme.desc: George Riley and Lynsey Hipgrave introduce highlights from the weekend's games, including Huddersfield Town v Newcastle United at John Smith's Stadium, Blackburn Rovers v Wigan Athletic at Ewood Park, and Fulham v Preston North End at Craven Cottage.(n)

programme.title: Football on 5: Goal Rush
programme.desc: George Riley and Lynsey Hipgrave introduce all the goals from the weekend's games in Leagues One and Two, including Rochdale v Sheffield United at Crown Oil Arena, and Plymouth Argyle v Carlisle United at Home Park.(n)

programme.title: The Fifth Element
programme.desc: In the 23rd century, the world faces destruction from a seemingly unstoppable force of pure evil. Meanwhile, a New York cab driver encounters a mysterious woman destined to save the Earth from its fate, and has to protect her from a scheming arms dealer and a horde of alien mercenaries. Luc Besson's sci-fi adventure, starring Bruce Willis, Milla Jovovich and Gary Oldman. Edited for language, nudity and sexual content.(n)

programme.title: Spies Like Us
programme.desc: Two incompetent US State Department officials are unwittingly used as decoys on a deadly mission to thwart Soviet activity in Pakistan. Unfortunately, their involvement in such a delicate operation brings the world to the brink of nuclear war. Comedy, starring Chevy Chase, Dan Aykroyd, Steve Forrest, Bruce Davison and Donna Dixon. Edited for daytime broadcast. Includes 5 News Update at 3.30pm.(n)

programme.title: Secrets of the National Trust with Alan Titchmarsh
programme.desc: The presenter visits an 18th-century cotton mill in Cheshire, one of the world's first factories, uncovering the stories of the child workers of the Industrial Revolution, whose parents could not afford to keep them. Oz Clarke climbs the battlements of Dunster Castle in Somerset, to examine the weaponry used to defend it when under attack during the English Civil War. Plus, Jon Culshaw visits a stately pile sandwiched between a council estate and a motorway, Dan Jones helps unearth rare evidence of a long-lost culture and Clive Aslet visits Biddulph Grange in Staffordshire.(n)

programme.title: Cruising with Jane McDonald
programme.desc: The singer heads to Alaska, America's largest state and home to some of the most breathtaking scenery on the planet. She takes a helicopter trip up to an ice field for a dog-sledding adventure, and later witnesses the majesty of the Margery glacier, a 21-mile stretch of ice in the Glacier Bay National Park. On board Holland America's ship Nieuw Amsterdam, Jane goes backstage to meet the cast of the nightly musicals, has a cooking lesson from the executive chef and reveals how to make the most of a lazy day in port.(n)

programme.title: Inside Windsor Castle
programme.desc: Documentary marking the centenary of the Windsor dynasty by examining the history of the royal residence over the past 80 years, looking at the tragedies and triumphs that have had an impact on the Queen and her family. The first edition reflects on the events of the past 25 years, including the fire in November 1992 that started in the private chapel and came at the end of a terrible year for the royals, with marital troubles hitting the Queen's three elder children.(n)

programme.title: Inside Windsor Castle
programme.desc: A look back at the series of events that shaped the monarchy between 1936 and 1952, using dramatic reconstructions and an extraordinary archive of film. Edward VIII's abdication in 1936 meant that his brother ?Bertie' became King George VI, and his eldest daughter Elizabeth was now suddenly and unexpectedly heir to the throne. When the Second World War broke out, Elizabeth and her sister Margaret moved into the safe haven that was Windsor Castle, which Elizabeth loved for its history and its heritage, while for Margaret it was one big adventure playground.(n)

programme.title: Nightmare Tenants, Slum Landlords
programme.desc: Cases include Wendy, who was left with rental arrears of almost £3,000 after renting a house out to a nightmare tenant. Steve from Birmingham Council's housing enforcement team investigates poor living conditions above a local shop. And in South London, lawyer Chris has to deal with his client's site which has been filled by nearly two dozen caravans and a mountain of rubbish.(n)

programme.title: 5 News Weekend
programme.desc: Round-up of the day's headlines from around the world.(n)

programme.title: The Story of
programme.sub-title: The Bruce Forsyth Story: From the Palladium to the Palace.
programme.desc: New series. A look back at the entertainer's 75 years in showbiz, featuring candid interviews with Forsyth and contributions from biographers, colleagues and famous fans. The programme charts his early career in London's variety clubs, before enjoying decades of success as host of Sunday Night at the London Palladium, The Generation Game, Play Your Cards Right and Strictly Come Dancing.(n)

programme.title: An Audience with Bruce Forsyth
programme.desc: The versatile veteran entertainer reveals his many talents in a feast of song, dance and humour recorded in 1997 in front of a VIP audience, who get the chance to quiz him about his remarkable career. Among those who join him on stage are former footballer Ian Wright, Ex-Coronation Street star Ken Morley, sports pundit Jimmy Hill and four-time Olympic gold medal-winning rower Matthew Pinsent.(n)

programme.title: Steptoe and Son
programme.desc: Rag-and-bone man Harold breaks away from his father for long enough to marry a glamorous stripper - but makes the short-sighted decision of letting his dishevelled dad tag along on their honeymoon. Comedy based on the TV series, starring Harry H Corbett, Wilfrid Brambell, Carolyn Seymour and Victor Maddern.(n)

programme.title: Thirteen
programme.desc: A thirteen-year-old girl's relationship with her mother is put to the test as she discovers drugs, sex, and petty crime in the company of her cool but troubled best friend(n)

programme.title: The Witches of Eastwick
programme.desc: On Thursday nights three female friends -- Alex, Sukie, and Jane -- meet to chug martinis, learn Chinese aphrodisiac cooking and lament the scarcity of eligible men. As they sit around, they fantasize about and describe their idea of the ideal male. Arriving in town the following day is Satan, disguised as mysterious stranger Darrell Van Horn. One by one, Van Horne seduces each of the women. Then, strange things begin to happen(n)

programme.title: Pale Rider
programme.desc: Clint Eastwood stars as the mysterious preacher determined to stop ruthless landowners from stealing the land of a group of poor gold miners(n)

programme.title: Hellboy II: The Golden Army
programme.desc: Comic book action fantasy. The big red demon with the stone hand returns with his buddies from the Bureau for Paranormal Research and Defense to save the world when an evil elf breaks an ancient pact and unleashes a robot army to destroy humanity(n)

programme.title: Trespass
programme.desc: Breathless thriller in which Walter Hill directs Bill Paxton and William Sadler, alias Vince and Don, a couple of firemen from Arkansas who stumble upon a secret which promises to make them millionaires. But then the local mob - led by the menacing King James - traps the men in a disused factory, apparently intent on forcing a deadly shoot-out(n)

programme.title: Tremors
programme.desc: Tongue-in-cheek horror tale in which a small Nevada desert town is terrorised by giant man-eating worms. Two handymen are forced to postpone their plans to escape their humdrum lives after several mysterious deaths and a series of earthquakes turn out to be the work of predatory subterranean creatures which lay siege to the terrified townsfolk(n)

programme.title: Cirque du Freak: The Vampire's Assistant
programme.desc: Teenager, Darren Shan, meets a mysterious man at a freak show who turns out to be a Vampire. After a series of events Darren must leave his normal life and go on the road with the Cirque Du Freak and become a Vampire(n)

programme.title: The Good Shepherd
programme.desc: Edward is recruited by a shadowy society at college and rises through the Cold War ranks to become a CIA spymaster. Intricate espionage thriller, only De Niro's second film as director(n)

programme.title: Eraser
programme.desc: Explosive, all-action thriller about a tough agent who guards witnesses on the federal protection programme but suspects that an insider is leaking information about his latest charge - a woman with evidence of a scheme to sell off top-secret weapons. When she proves unusually difficult to protect, he realises he is also dealing with an enemy within his own organisation(n)

programme.title: Changing Lanes
programme.desc: Director Roger Michell follows up the hit romantic comedy Notting Hill with this thought-provoking thriller. Ben Affleck and Samuel L. Jackson star, respectively, as Gavin Banek and Doyle Gibson, two New York men whose lives become accidentally intertwined in a Good Friday fender bender on the FDR Drive. Late for a crucial appointment, hotshot lawyer Gavin tosses Doyle a blank check and leaves the scene, while Doyle, whose car is inoperable, is late for a court-appointed custody hearing. A recovering alcoholic, Doyle's tardiness doesn't sit well with the judge, who - sick of waiting for Gipson - grants custody to Doyle's ex-wife in Doyle's absence. The situation worsens when it becomes evident that Doyle has an equally important file belonging to Gavin, which proves that an elderly man gave Banek's firm power-of-attorney over his foundation. So begins an escalating war of words and deeds between the two men. Soon, egged on by an associate, Gavin hires a "fixer" to destroy Doyle's credit, forcing Doyle to fire back with some cunning moves of his own(n)

programme.title: Pearl Harbor
programme.desc: The surprise Japanese attack is the backdrop of a love triangle involving a nurse and two fighter pilots(n)

programme.title: Our Brand Is Crisis
programme.desc: A female political consultant is hired to work on the campaign of a Bolivian presidential candidate who has fallen behind in the polls. She faces off against her rival, who is working on the opponent's campaign and is looking for every opportunity to antagonize her(n)

programme.title: Emelie
programme.desc: Two suburban parents hire a new babysitter to look after their three kids while they enjoy a night out, but the sitter eventually reveals herself to be an unhinged imposter who has sinister designs on the family's youngest child(n)

programme.title: The Man From U.N.C.L.E.
programme.desc: In this spy thriller set in the early 1960s, CIA agent Napoleon Solo and KGB operative Illya Kuryakin team up to stop an international criminal organisation that is trafficking nuclear weapons and technology. Adaptation of the TV series of the same name(n)

programme.title: Dog Day Afternoon
programme.desc: Sonny plans a bank robbery to pay for a sex-change operation for his gay lover. But when the heist goes wrong, he and silent Sal take the bank staff hostage. Thriller(n)

programme.title: Welcome to Mooseport
programme.desc: When ex-President Monroe Cole retires to a small town, the locals invite him to run for mayor. Plumber 'Handy' Harrison is planning to run too. Cole persuades Harrison to stand down, but when the statesman starts to romance Handy's girlfriend, the plumber re-enters the race(n)

programme.title: Definitely, Maybe
programme.desc: A political consultant in the midst of a bitter divorce attempts to delicately divulge the truth about his past relationships to his curious young daughter, who simply won't stop asking questions until she's satisfied with all the answers. Ten-year-old Maya (Abigail Breslin) is heartbroken to see her parents splitting up, but she's determined to find out precisely how it was that mom and dad came together in the first place. When Maya starts questioning her father Will (Ryan Reynolds) about his life before marriage, dad's memories soon drift back to the time when, as a naïve Wisconsin native and aspiring politician hoping to work on the presidential election, he first arrived in New York City. As Will gradually became savvy to the ways of the big city, he gradually developed romantic relationships with three very different women: Emily (Elizabeth Banks) was the girl-next-door that he could always depend on, apolitical April (Isla Fisher) was the best friend and confidante who was always there to listen, and free-spirited journalist Summer (Rachel Weisz) was both beautiful and ambitious. In order to prevent his perceptive little girl from predicting the outcome before his story is told, Will carefully changes the names of his three romantic interests, creating a hopelessly romantic puzzle that highlights both the joys and hardships of true love(n)

programme.title: The Pianist
programme.desc: A pianist in Warsaw is thrown out of a job when the Nazis invade. He hides in the ruined city, dodging the squads who carry off Jews to the death camps(n)

programme.title: Mission: Impossible II
programme.desc: Special agent Ethan Hunt is plunged into an international crisis. With computer genius Ving Rhames at his side and beautiful thief Thandie Newton on his mind, Hunt races across Australia and Spain on an impossible mission(n)

programme.title: Trapped
programme.desc: In this tense thriller, a young girl with asthma is kidnapped and held for ransom, but her captors tell her parents that they'll deprive the child of her medication unless they comply with their terms, one of which is not to contact the police(n)

programme.title: Lara Croft: Tomb Raider
programme.desc: The gun-toting treasure seeker is thrown into a furious battle with a mysterious secret society as she races against time to locate the missing pieces of the Triangle of Light, a legendary artefact that grants the owner the ability to control time(n)

programme.title: Vacation
programme.desc: In this installment of the "Vacation" series, the youngest son of the Griswold clan, now grown with a family of his own, sets out to recreate a cross-country road trip from his youth to an amusement park(n)

programme.title: Spy
programme.desc: After years of doing work integral to the success of major missions, an intelligent but self-conscious deskbound CIA analyst (Melissa McCarthy) is finally given the chance to go undercover as a homely "cat lady" in order to save her missing partner (Jude Law) and thwart a global disaster at the hands of a dangerous arms dealer. Written and directed by Paul Feig(n)

programme.title: Pan
programme.desc: An orphan boy discovers his destiny as Peter Pan, and is whisked away to an enchanted land to battle the fearsome pirate Blackbeard with the help of the warrior woman Tiger Lily(n)

programme.title: Transformers: Revenge of the Fallen
programme.desc: Director Michael Bay returns with his second instalment of the sci-fi action romp that pits humans against some big, bad (very bad) alien robots, the Decepticons. In this sequel, which manages to be even louder and more prone to explosions than the initial outing, Sam Witwicky and his girlfriend Mikaela Banes are once more at the centre of the action. Witwicky is being hunted down by the Decepticons, who recognise that he is their main impediment to their gaining control of an awesome source of energy. As the Decepticons' plan would result in the destruction of the Sun, mankind's fate rests on the shoulders (and in the ingenuity) of our oddly named hero... Edited for language and violence(n)

programme.title: Thirteen
programme.desc: A thirteen-year-old girl's relationship with her mother is put to the test as she discovers drugs, sex, and petty crime in the company of her cool but troubled best friend(n)

programme.desc: Define your body with PiYo. Chalene Johnson's new lower-impact workout series combining the muscle-sculpting benefits of Pilates, Yoga and fluid motion all-in-one!(n)

programme.title: Crank Yankers
programme.desc: No additional information is available(n)

programme.title: South Park
programme.desc: It's a Jersey Thing. Kyle discovers a family secret and the town of South Park must defend itself against being swallowed up by New Jersey and its reality TV stars - especially the monstrous Snooki!(n)

programme.title: South Park
programme.desc: Raising the Bar. Cartman finally comes to the realisation that he's overweight, but declares that the solution is to ride around on a mobility scooter. Also, Cartman learns he has a rival in a young reality-TV star(n)

programme.title: South Park
programme.desc: A Ladder to Heaven. The boys have to find a way to reach Kenny before they lose their chance at untold candy riches; what better way to achieve this than a ladder to heaven - because Kenny's dead(n)

programme.title: South Park
programme.desc: Stanley's Cup. In a parody of underdog sports movies, Stan is sentenced to community service and ends up coaching the Park County Pee-Wee hockey team - can he turn these losers into winners?(n)

programme.title: South Park
programme.desc: Free Hat. Kyle, Stan, Cartman and Tweek get angry about Steven Spielberg and George Lucas's habit of altering their films with each re-re-re-release. The boys go on a mission to steal the movies…(n)

programme.title: Futurama
programme.desc: Crimes of the Hot. As Earth is unable to counter its rising temperature through the usual method (the dropping of a giant ice cube into the ocean), Gore leads an emergency conference in Kyoto, Japan, where Professor Farnsworth claims responsibility for the crisis. It seems love detoured him from observing proper emission standards on his prototype robot, and that could necessitate the destruction of all its "descendants." That includes Bender, who resigns himself to having a farewell blowout before being blown up(n)

programme.title: Futurama
programme.desc: Jurassic Bark. Bender gets jealous when it looks like cloning will reunite Fry with his dog from the 20th century(n)

programme.title: Futurama
programme.desc: Route of All Evil. After being told to get jobs, the wayward sons of Hermes and the Professor open a competing delivery service that puts Planet Express out of business(n)

programme.title: Futurama
programme.desc: Taste of Freedom. In celebration of Freedom Day, Dr Zoidberg eats the Earth flag, for which he is sentenced to death. In retaliation, the Decapodians enslave the entire world(n)

programme.title: Half Baked
programme.desc: Comedy in which a well-meaning teacher finds himself in jail after accidentally killing a police horse. Now he must rely on his permanently-stoned roommates to raise the $100,000 bail money to facilitate his release!(n)

programme.title: Napoleon Dynamite
programme.desc: The directorial debut of filmmaker Jared Hess, who also co-wrote the screenplay, Napoleon Dynamite is a quirky, offbeat comedy set in the small Idaho town of Preston. Jon Heder stars in the titular role, a carrot-topped oddball with a decidedly eccentric family that includes his llama-loving, dune-buggy enthusiast grandmother. The story centers on the local high school's race for class president. Using some nontraditional means, Napoleon is determined to help his pal Pedro (Efrem Ramirez) run a winning campaign and defeat popular girl Summer (Haylie Duff). Also starring The Drew Carey Show's Diedrich Bader, Napoleon Dynamite premiered at the 2004 Sundance Film Festival(n)

programme.title: South Park
programme.desc: The Jeffersons. All the children of South Park are attracted to Mr. Jefferson, his son and their home filled with games, toys and animals. Series 8, Episode 6(n)

programme.title: South Park
programme.desc: The Death of Eric Cartman. When everyone decides to ignore Cartman, he is convinced he is dead and must find peace by making amends for his past sins. Will Butters' unique 'psychic ability' help him?(n)

programme.title: South Park
programme.desc: T.M.I. Brand new and exclusive to Comedy Central. After an embarrassing incident involving boy parts, Cartman is sent to anger management and Randy tries to deal with the fallout(n)

programme.title: South Park
programme.desc: Miss Teacher Bangs a Boy. Cartman, South Park Elementary's new hallway monitor, takes it personally when he finds out that a teacher has been kissing a student in his jurisdiction. Series 10, Episode 10(n)

programme.title: Liar Liar
programme.desc: A slick, overachieving lawyer is forced to tell the truth, the whole truth and nothing but the truth(n)

programme.title: Fun With Dick and Jane

programme.title: Man on Earth
programme.desc: Tony Robinson looks back through 200,000 years of human history to discover the effects of fluctuating weather patterns on the development of civilisation. Accompanied by archaeologist Dr Jago Cooper and climate modeller Dr Joy Singarayer, he begins by exploring a group of early African ancestors rescued from extinction by global warming, and Neanderthals who died out in isolated communities.(n)

programme.title: Man on Earth
programme.desc: Tony Robinson traces the impact of global warming at the end of the last ice age, discovering it was the catalyst for the dawn of civilisation, but it also unleashed devastation. In Europe, the rise in temperature prompted an agricultural revolution, while in North Africa, a drought led Saharan refugees to settle along the River Nile, developing new social structures and going on to found the kingdom of Egypt.(n)

programme.title: Time Team
programme.desc: The archaeologists have a short time-span and must fend off stiff opposition from English Heritage to uncover a medieval castle and a Jacobean or possibly Tudor house in historic Malton, North Yorkshire.(n)

programme.desc: Archaeologist Kirk French and anthropologist Jason De Leon attend excavations around the US in a bid to unearth lost items from the country's history.(n)

programme.title: Weapons of War

programme.title: Battle Castle with Dan Snow

programme.title: Planes That Never Flew
programme.desc: A documentary on the SST, America's answer to Concorde in the competition between Europe and the United States to build a supersonic airliner.(n)

programme.title: Man on Earth
programme.desc: Tony Robinson investigates the ruins of three civilisations over the past 2,000 years to ask what made them more vulnerable to climate catastrophe than the ones that survived. In the jungles of Central America, he learns about the effect of a decades-long drought on the Mayans, while Dr Joy Singarayer visits Greenland to discover how a mini ice age in the 13th century wiped out the Vikings. In the deserts of America's southwest, Dr Jago Cooper explores the crisis that made the inhabitants of cliff cities homeless.(n)

programme.title: Man on Earth
programme.desc: Tony Robinson examines societies that have flourished as a result of climate change. In Peru, the Hauri people responded to a savage drought by developing advanced water management techniques, while in Europe, a mini ice age triggered the Black Death, which resulted in a period of unprecedented progression. The Industrial Revolution was hastened by the benefits of a stable weather pattern, but this appears to be ending, bringing a new threat to mankind.(n)

programme.title: Time Team
programme.desc: The Ministry of Defence allows Tony Robinson and his crew to investigate the likely site of a Roman villa first discovered in 1907 behind the barbed wire of Wiltshire's Netheravon army barracks. However, a combination of vague initial measurements and recent land development render the team's standard short cuts almost useless.(n)

The remains of two B-17s that collided in mid-air in February 1944 were left unsalvaged following the burial of the crews, presenting a modern-day team of experts with the question of what could have caused the accident.(n)

programme.title: Time Team
programme.desc: Tony Robinson and the team of diggers break a golden rule and return to the site of a previous excavation in the Cotswolds, where the remains of a Roman villa were uncovered. This time they solve the mystery of why the building was situated so close to ancient industrial workings and discover the reason for constructing the bath-house in such an isolated spot.(n)

programme.desc: The story of a skull recently discovered in an attic in France, which was revealed to be the head of king Henry IV of France - decapitated by French revolutionaries in 1789.(n)

programme.title: Last Tango in Halifax
programme.desc: Old friends Celia Dawson and Alan Buttershaw are both widowed and in their 70s, and have not seen each other for 60 years. When they are reunited over the internet and arrange to meet up, they discover it was an unfortunate twist of fate that prevented them getting together all those years ago. All at once, their feelings for each other are reignited and they make a snap decision. But when their daughters - buttoned-up headmistress Caroline and happy-go-lucky farmer Gillian - arrive at the pub to pick their parents up, how will they feel about becoming sisters-in-law? Sally Wainwright's light-hearted drama stars Derek Jacobi and Anne Reid as the second-time-around lovers, with Sarah Lancashire and Nicola Walker.(n)

The youngsters involved in the earlier case escaped - though their abductor was never found. programme.title: Silent Witness
programme.desc: Feature-length episode. The team attends a triple murder at a farmhouse, where the investigating detective, Supt Tom Byrne, wastes no time making his presence felt. The pathologists soon make a breakthrough when DNA found at the scene matches that of a mysterious female serial killer - although Nikki has cause to question the direction they are heading in. The case is proving difficult for Leo, however, whose mind is in turmoil following the suicide of an old friend. Guest starring Vincent Regan and Shelley Conn.(n)

programme.title: Wedding Crashers
programme.desc: Owen Wilson and VInce Vaughn star in David Dobkin's romantic comedy as John Beckwith and Jeremy Gray, two long-term buddies who've worked out that weddings are the ideal place to pick up women at their most romantically vulnerable moment. But having turned crashing them into a fine art, complete with a list of rules 100 items long, things start to go wrong. They manage to crash the event of the year, a weekend-long celebration for the wedding of the daughter of William Cleary, Secretary of the Treasury and a possible candidate for the Presidency. But John makes the mistake of falling for the bride's sister Claire Cleary, while Jeremy has to fight off her clingy sister Gloria. And the longer the weekend goes on, the more likely it is that their cover will be blown(n)

programme.title: E:60
programme.desc: Originally titled ESPN Reports, this was the cable service's effort to create a 60 Minutes-style weekly newsmagazine focusing on sports. The first episode set the tone with a piece on the "football fever" at Miami Northwestern High School, an interview with former major leaguer Cecil Fielder, a human-interest story concerning the tragically premature death of UNC Tar Heels "mascot" Jason Ray, and some musings from self-proclaimed sports psychic Dr. Bob. The individual segments were handled by such correspondents as Jeremy Schaap, Michael Smith, Rachel Nichols, Lisa Salters and Tom Ferry, while Bill Simmons, aka "The Sports Guy", appeared at the end of each episode with a few Andy Rooney-like random comments. Almost universally derided by the "legitimate" cable-news establishment, the series was generally praised by viewers as a noble effort to bring a straight-news slant to ESPN's familiar sports reportage. E:60 first aired on October 16, 2007(n)

programme.title: Moonlight Mile
programme.desc: A family attempts to deal with the emotional impact of an unexpected loss in this emotional drama set in the early 1970s. Diana Floss (Careena Melia) is a woman in her early twenties who is only days away from marrying her boyfriend, Joe Nast (Jake Gyllenhaal), to the delight of her parents, Ben and Jo Jo (Dustin Hoffman and Susan Sarandon). However, Diana finds herself in the wrong place at the wrong time when an altercation breaks out in a diner, and she's murdered for no good reason. Ben and Jo Jo are devastated, and they both turn to Joe for comfort, treating him as a member of the family, with Ben offering him a job at his real estate firm and Jo Jo grateful for his company, despite her unflappable surface. Joe also finds himself needing comfort, and he becomes involved with Bertie (Ellen Pompeo), a woman who waits tables at a local watering hole owned by her boyfriend, who has been listed as Missing in Action in Vietnam for the past three years. However, as the wheels of justice slowly turn and the Floss' lawyer, Mona Camp (Holly Hunter), prepares Ben and Jo Jo for the upcoming murder trial, Joe is tortured by a guilty secret -- he and Diana had a falling out, and planned to call off the wedding shortly before her unexpected death. Moonlight Mile was written and directed by Brad Silberling, who has had his own experiences with death and grieving to draw from -- he was dating actress Rebecca Schaeffer when she was murdered by a stalker in 1989(n)

programme.title: Booty Call
programme.desc: Two couples out on a date together grapple to tell the difference between love and lust.. Mild-mannered Rushon and Nikki who have been going out for about seven weeks seem to like each other well enough, but the relationship has been mainly platonic, and Nikki isn't so sure that she wants that to change. Rushon asks Nikki out to dinner, but Nikki wants to bring along her tart-tongued friend Lysterine. Rushon has to find a date for her, and he comes up with his rude-boy buddy Bunz(n)

programme.title: The Pink Panther
programme.desc: The prequel to the 1964 comic gem of the same name stars Steve Martin as hapless Inspector Clouseau, investigating murder and the theft of a priceless jewel(n)

programme.title: The Pink Panther 2

programme.title: U-571
programme.desc: Masquerading as Nazis, a secret team of American commandos attempts to steal a decoding machine from a sinking German U-boat. But their plan goes awry when their own ship is destroyed, and they are stranded on the enemy sub. Oscar-winning World War II thriller stars Matthew McConaughey, Oscar-nominee Harvey Keitel, Golden Globe-nominees Bill Paxton and David Keith, and rock star Jon Bon Jovi. Inspired by actual events(n)

Annie is one of Elliott's party. In the face of a threatening storm, Elliott recklessly insists the climb should continue. The storm duly arrives and decimates the expedition, leaving Elliott and Annie stranded. Peter leads a group of climbers-including the grizzled Montgomery Wick and a French-Canadian nurse in a rescue attempt(n)

programme.title: Valkyrie
programme.desc: Based on actual events, ¿Valkyrie¿ goes back to the Nazi Germany during WWII as the tide turns in favor of the Allies. A proud military man, Colonel Claus von Stauffenberg (Tom Cruise) desperately plots to topple the Nazi regime before the nation is crushed in a near-inevitable defeat. Realizing that time is running out, he decides that he must take action himself and joins the German resistance. Armed with a cunning strategy to use Hitler's own emergency plan - known as Operation Valkyrie - von Stauffenberg and his men plot to assassinate the dictator and overthrow his Nazi government from the inside(n)

programme.title: Hackers
programme.desc: Thriller for the '90s in which Jonny Lee Miller stars as Dade Murphy, aka Zero Cool, a teenager renowned among his peers for crashing over 1,500 Wall Street computers at the age of 11. Now 18, Dade is anxious to get back into the world of hacking from which he has been banned for the last seven years. Having joined forces with a feisty fellow hacker named Kate Libby (Angelina Jolie), aka Acid Burn, Dade finds himself set up by a master hacker who has framed them for stealing millions of dollars from a major corporation(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: A US Navy Public Affairs Officer is killed, and when the team takes up the case, both the man's wife and his mistress emerge as potential suspects. Each woman offering a very different take on the chain of events that led to the murder, and the investigators are forced to decide which of the two is telling the truth. Meanwhile, DiNozzo's father comes to the aid of a homeless woman, who makes a surprising claim about his relationship with her. Guest starring Robert Wagner.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: Tony finds himself in a difficult position when his identity is stolen. Worse yet, multiple fraudsters make use of his status as a special agent to blackmail US senators, and as the chain of events begins to spiral out of control, it is left to the real Dinozzo to bring the perpetrators to justice. Naval crime drama, starring Michael Weatherly.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: Gibbs teams up with his old friend Senior FBI Agent TC Fornell after two British prisoners, including a former spy, escape captivity and flee to the US via a shipping container. Meanwhile, McGee is busy hunting for a new apartment, and is determined to discover how DiNozzo managed to snag his lavish home. Naval crime drama, guest starring Joe Spano.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: A 14-year-old boy manages to foil a home invasion, but when Gibbs is called in to investigate, he suspects the teenager may be withholding crucial information. As the case makes progress, Gibbs turns his attention to helping the boy's mother, the wife of a Naval officer, and his efforts result in an invitation to the White House to meet the First Lady (Michelle Obama, guest starring as herself). Meanwhile, Director Vance and FBI Agent Fornell travel to London as part of the ongoing case involving the escaped British spies.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: The team, alongside the FBI and MI6, continues the international manhunt for an escaped British spy, while a colleague fights for their life in the ICU.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: Ellie is sent to Gitmo to gather evidence in the case relating to the murder of a US Navy chaplain, and while there, she is given cause to question her previous work at the NSA.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: The team investigates a series of escalating threats against congresswoman Jenna Flemming, while Director Vance oversees temporary protection detail.(n)

programme.title: Bull
programme.desc: The consultant's ex-wife Isabella Colon faces a wrongful death lawsuit, and Bull's efforts to help are hindered by unresolved issues from their marriage.(n)

programme.title: The Mentalist
programme.desc: A lawyer is killed in an explosion on his boat, leaving the team to find out that he was accused of cheating by a mob boss, so Cho goes undercover at one of the criminal's gaming nights to see what he can learn. Back at CBI headquarters, FBI Agent Darcy has been assigned to re-examine the case of serial killer Panzer, but Jane believes her life is in danger when Red John sends them doctored footage of her. Crime drama, guest starring Catherine Dent and Rudolf Martin, with Simon Baker.(n)

programme.title: The Mentalist
programme.desc: The FBI's investigation into the death of Van Pelt's fiance comes to an end, just in time for her to help investigate the murder of a mob boss's son, who was killed while celebrating the prospect of taking control of the business from his ailing father. While Jane and the others focus their inquiries on the rest of the crime family, Grace takes the only witness in for interrogation, but is distracted by her own problems, and forced into a game of cat-and-mouse against a determined assassin. Drama, starring Amanda Righetti.(n)

programme.title: The Mentalist
programme.desc: Jane and Lisbon investigate the murder of an out-of-favour fashion designer who was planning to revitalise his career by launching a new clothing line, but first have to track down the man employed to make the outfits. Darcy continues to re-examine the Panzer case, talking to a blind woman who was friends with Red John - only for her to reveal the serial killer is still alive. Crime drama, starring Simon Baker and Robin Tunney.(n)

programme.title: The Mentalist
programme.desc: A woman looks set to be convicted of murdering her dance teacher, but Jane believes she is innocent after watching her give a press conference. He tries to prove she is not the killer before the jury's verdict is read out in court - so he announces that footage has been found of the crime taking place and waits to see who takes the bait. Crime drama, guest starring Ian Kahn, Diane Farr and James Frain, with Simon Baker.(n)

programme.title: The Mentalist
programme.desc: A woman convicted of murdering her husband is given permission to leave jail for a few days to help Jane track down a former charity worker's killer, and they learn the philanthropist the victim once worked for is not as benevolent as he seems. However, as the case progresses, the consultant's new partner uses her charms to try to fool him and make a bid for her freedom. Crime drama, guest starring Morena Baccarin (Homeland), with Simon Baker.(n)

programme.title: 24: Legacy
programme.desc: Carter escapes from the police precinct, and places his trust in the CTU as he plan to meet Grimes and make the exchange. Meanwhile, Rebecca and Donovan try to isolate the leak.(n)

programme.title: Family Guy
programme.desc: Peter faces a backlash over a misogynistic comic strip so the Griffins flee Quahog, and find themselves in Springfield, home to the Simpsons. However, when their car is stolen they become stuck in the town.(n)

programme.title: Family Guy
programme.desc: Brian is convicted of drink-driving and has to look after a cantankerous elderly woman as part of his community service. As their relationship develops, she reveals intriguing details of her past. Meanwhile, a swallow builds its nest in Peter's newly grown beard.(n)

programme.title: Family Guy
programme.desc: Peter and Lois are horrified to learn Meg is going out with a naturist. Meanwhile, Stewie enrols at the local drama school and shows promise - but his chances of success are compromised by rivalry with an ambitious fellow student.(n)

programme.title: American Dad
programme.desc: Stan becomes jealous when he discovers Francine was once engaged to a pilot whose plane crashed. However, it emerges his wife's would-be husband survived the incident, and the envious spy enlists Roger's help to track him down.(n)

programme.title: American Dad
programme.desc: Steve dons a mask and takes revenge on the popular girls at his school for humiliating his girlfriend Debbie. When his identity is exposed, he is forced to flee from an angry mob along with his friends. With the guest voice of Lizzy Caplan.(n)

programme.title: Family Guy
programme.desc: Peter is mortified to find out Lois is meeting an old boyfriend and struggles to contain his jealousy. Meanwhile, Brian and Stewie are accidentally stuck together with strong industrial adhesive.(n)

programme.title: Family Guy
programme.desc: Stewie sets off for England to take refuge in his favourite TV show, but ends up taking a detour to Saudi Arabia. Meanwhile, Lois embarrasses Peter at a concert. With the guest voices of rock band Kiss.(n)

programme.title: American Dad
programme.desc: Hayley splits up with her boyfriend Jeff and ends up falling for Stan's CIA body double, who in turn starts flirting with Francine. Meanwhile, Steve rescues chickens from a slurry factory. Animated comedy, featuring the voices of Seth MacFarlane and Scott Grimes.(n)

programme.title: American Dad
programme.desc: Roger suggests Stan hold a telethon to replace money lost in CIA budget cuts, but the spy takes all the credit for the idea, prompting his alien lodger to sabotage the event.(n)

programme.title: Family Guy
programme.desc: A trio of stories inspired by viewers' letters, including a tale in which Peter appears with his pals as vintage screen comedy team the Little Rascals, and another in which the Griffins gain superpowers - much to the neighbourhood's astonishment.(n)

programme.title: Family Guy
programme.sub-title: When You Wish Upon a Weinstein.

programme.title: American Dad

programme.title: American Dad
programme.desc: Stan is given pills by a colleague that enable him to stay awake all night so he can spend more time enjoying his hobbies, but when Francine discovers his nocturnal activities, she wants to join him. Meanwhile, Steve and Roger try to write a script for a pornographic film.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: The international manhunt continues as the FBI and NCIS collaborate with MI6 to catch an escaped British spy, who is targeting current and former agents.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: Tony tries to piece together the events that led to him lying wounded in a hospital bed, having been shot in the chest through his bulletproof vest. Under the guidance of therapist Dr Rachel Cranston, his memory begins to return and suspicion falls on his ex-lover EJ Barrett. Starring Mark Harmon, Michael Weatherly and Sarah Jane Morris.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: The investigators examine the death of US marine Tommy Hill, who appears to have been fatally stabbed en route to a homecoming party thrown in his honour by his foster family. McGee and Ziva follow a trail of blood that leads them to a mobile phone, while Abby discovers the victim had been trying to hack into Virginia's state website and Ducky's autopsy reveals that Hill had been injected with a sedative.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: US Navy lieutenant Paul Booth is shot dead while sitting on a park bench. It turns out that the last people he called were his boss, his wife and Penelope Langston - a rebellious academic who also happens to be McGee's grandmother. She says that the victim was an old student of hers who kept in touch, but later reveals she was recruited to work on a special project during the Vietnam War by the head of a top-secret think tank Booth was a member of. Guest starring Lily Tomlin, with Mark Harmon and Sean Murray.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: A man who died after being knocked down by a van is revealed to be a professional hitman responsible for at least six contract killings - and his next target was to be a navy lieutenant commander. Meanwhile, Abby is delighted at being a match for a teenager who needs a kidney transplant, but she is informed that someone else with very similar DNA has also been identified as suitable. Has she found a relative she never knew about? Guest starring Brett Tucker (Neighbours).(n)

programme.title: The Mentalist
programme.desc: A man who wanted to expose the killer of the Visualise cult co-founder is murdered, leading the team to investigate old adversary Bret Stiles, who was photographed wearing a bloodied suit. As the sect's inner circle meets to elect a new leader, Jane hopes spreading a rumour will help him catch the culprit - but when nobody takes the bait, he has to change his tactics. Crime drama, guest starring Malcolm McDowell, with Simon Baker.(n)

programme.title: The Mentalist
programme.desc: Lisbon and the team examine the murder of a Shakespeare enthusiast and become suspicious of the victim's billionaire employer when he announces a $10million reward for information about the case, despite having a reputation for frugality. Meanwhile, FBI agent Susan Darcy enlists Jane's help to investigate the killing of a woman whose body was found in woods, and their only clue is a piece of glass from a wine bottle. Crime drama, starring Robin Tunney and Simon Baker.(n)

programme.title: The Mentalist
programme.desc: A wealthy man who had cancer is found murdered, despite only having weeks left to live, leaving the team suspecting one of his relatives could be to blame. Jane discovers his son was being cut out of the will and his wife was pretending to be ill in a con to win the affections of rich men. He is also led to a charlatan healer selling a special kind of tea after noticing an unusual smell on the body. Crime drama, starring Simon Baker and Robin Tunney.(n)

programme.title: The Mentalist
programme.desc: A casino security guard is killed and the team investigates his place of work, leading Jane to meet a magician he used to work with. He discovers his former colleague is planning to rob the business because his girlfriend has been kidnapped, and sets up a daring robbery as part of a live show in the hope of learning the murderer's identity. Crime drama, guest starring Christopher Judge, with Simon Baker and Robin Tunney.(n)

programme.title: The Mentalist
programme.desc: A popular teacher is found murdered and the team discovers hate mail in his bag. However, as the investigation gets under way, the agents discover the victim's behaviour had always been immaculate, ruling out any wrongdoing when traces of drugs are found in his car and a pupil accuses him of sleeping with a prostitute. Jane focuses on the relationship between the director of the school play and the lead actor, and even performs as an understudy to unravel more details about the crime. Starring Simon Baker and Robin Tunney.(n)

programme.title: X-Men: First Class
programme.desc: Set in the era before Professor Charles Xavier and Erik Lehnsherr became mortal enemies as Professor X and Magneto, the two former allies lead a powerful team of mutants on a mission to save the planet from nuclear annihilation. As the Doomsday Clock ticks faster toward midnight, the time comes to take action. In the process of saving humanity, however, Charles and Erik clash(n)

programme.title: The Wolverine
programme.desc: A haunted Wolverine (Hugh Jackman) journeys to Japan to bid an old friend farewell, and gets drawn into a conflict involving ninja and yakuza in stand-alone spin-off set following the events of X-Men: The Last Stand, and preceding the events of X-Men: Days of Future Past. The story begins in Nagasaki. As a B-29 bomber appears in the sky and air-raid sirens howl, panicked Japanese troops begin committing ritual seppuku. Terrified, yet unwilling to sacrifice his own life, young soldier Yashida takes cover in a heavily fortified prison pit containing the immortal mutant Wolverine, who shields him from a deadly blast. Decades later, Wolverine has sworn off violence after he was forced to kill his beloved Jean Grey (Famke Janssen). He's confronting a hunter who has been using illegal, poison-tipped arrows when the sword-wielding Yukio (Rila Fukushima) comes to his aid, and summons him to Japan at the behest of the dying Yashida (Hal Yamanouchi), now the head of Japan's largest and most powerful tech giant. Just hours before passing away, Yashida implores Wolverine to protect his granddaughter Mariko (Tao Okamato), whom he has personally chosen to take over the family business -- much to the chagrin of her plotting father Shingen (Hiroyuki Sanada). When the yakuza attempt a high-profile kidnapping of Mariko during Yashida's funeral, Wolverine comes to her rescue, and receives some much needed help from enigmatic ninja Harada (Will Yun Lee). Narrowly escaping with their lives, Wolverine and Mariko go into hiding with the yakuza and ruthless mutant Viper (Svetlana Khodchenkova) hot on their trail. But the battle is far from over, and with Wolverine's healing powers mysteriously diminished, he may not be able to protect Mariko for long(n)

programme.title: Mr Popper's Penguins
programme.desc: A workaholic businessman always puts his job before his family until he receives an unexpected inheritance from his explorer father - six penguins. He abandons his plan to offload the birds to a zoo when he finds his kids love them, and sets about turning his New York apartment into a suitable habitat. Family comedy, starring Jim Carrey, Carla Gugino and Angela Lansbury.(n)

programme.title: The Chronicles of Narnia: The Voyage of the Dawn Treader
programme.desc: Lucy and Edmund Pevensie return to the magical world accompanied by their selfish cousin. They join their old friend King Caspian as he sets sail across the sea in search of seven of his father's allies who had been banished years before, but along the way they discover an evil force is growing in strength. Fantasy adventure, with Georgie Henley, Skandar Keynes, Will Poulter and Ben Barnes.(n)

programme.title: Spy Kids 4: All the Time in the World
programme.desc: A secret agent decides to retire after having a baby, while her two stepchildren remain completely unaware of her exciting past. They stumble on to the truth when she is recalled to duty and, with the aid of two former junior spies, they help battle an evil mastermind who has the power to control time. Family adventure, starring Jessica Alba, Jeremy Piven, Rowan Blanchard and Mason Cook.(n)

programme.title: Casper
programme.desc: A paranormal expert moves into a haunted house where his daughter befriends the amiable ghost of a young boy - but things start to go awry when three smelly spooks and two dastardly crooks try to chase the new residents away. Family comedy, starring Christina Ricci, Bill Pullman, Eric Idle, Cathy Moriarty and featuring the voice of Malachi Pearson.(n)

programme.title: X-Men
programme.desc: Super-powered outsiders Rogue and Wolverine find themselves at a school for mutants which is run by a benevolent psychic professor. While there, they agree to join others with similar gifts to take on a superhuman mutant terrorist faction intent on establishing dominance over mankind. Sci-fi comic-book adventure, starring Hugh Jackman, Patrick Stewart, Ian McKellen, Anna Paquin and Halle Berry.(n)

programme.title: The Rewrite
programme.desc: A washed-up Hollywood screenwriter takes a job at a small university, planning to exploit his position as a local celebrity and do as little work as possible. His cynical outlook begins to change when he falls for a single mother working toward her degree, while a talented pupil makes him consider what he wants from his life. Romantic comedy, with Hugh Grant, Marisa Tomei, Allison Janney and JK Simmons.(n)

programme.title: Stonehearst Asylum
programme.desc: A new apprentice at a lunatic asylum is intrigued by the unusual methods of the doctor in charge. He realises too late that the doctor is actually a patient who has taken over with the intent of establishing his own form of society - a plan that leads to chaos. Gothic horror based on Edgar Allen Poe's short story Eliza Graves, starring Kate Beckinsale, Jim Sturgess, David Thewlis and Michael Caine.(n)

programme.title: Sorority Row
programme.desc: Five female students accidentally cause the death of one of their friends when a prank goes wrong, so hide the body and keep their part in her demise a secret. A year later, as they prepare to graduate, they are stalked by a mysterious killer seeking justice for their crime. Horror remake, starring Briana Evigan, Leah Pipes and Rumer Willis.(n)

programme.title: The First Film
programme.desc: Premiere. David Nicholas Wilkinson's documentary charts his quest to prove the world's earliest surviving film was shot in his native Leeds in 1888 by Frenchman Louis Le Prince. The film-maker and archivist Irfan Shan explores the trailblazing techniques and equipment Le Prince employed to realise his groundbreaking achievement and also turn their attention to what happened to Le Prince just two years after his visit to West Yorkshire.(n)

programme.title: Hugo
programme.desc: An orphan lives in the walls of a 1930s railway station, hiding from the inspector who would send him to an orphanage. He scours the station for parts to complete a clockwork robot belonging to his father, a quest which leads him to uncover a lonely shopkeeper's mysterious past. Martin Scorsese's family adventure, starring Asa Butterfield, Chloe Grace Moretz and Ben Kingsley.(n)

programme.title: Carry On Behind
programme.desc: Professors Ronald Crump and Anna Vooshka embark on an archaeological dig, but find their efforts disrupted by the saucy shenanigans of a motley bunch of holiday-makers in the neighbouring caravan park. Comedy, starring Kenneth Williams, Elke Sommer, Joan Sims, Windsor Davies, Kenneth Connor and Bernard Bresslaw.(n)

programme.title: Ice Age: Continental Drift
programme.desc: A cataclysm leaves prehistoric animals Manny, Sid and Diego lost at sea on a drifting iceberg. They try to find a way to return home, embarking on a journey that leads to an encounter with a ferocious band of piratical creatures. Animated comedy sequel, with the voices of Ray Romano, John Leguizamo, Denis Leary and Peter Dinklage.(n)

programme.title: Johnny English
programme.desc: A bumbling secret agent becomes Britain's leading spy following the assassination of all the country's other espionage experts. Single-handedly he sets out to unmask a mysterious villain responsible for stealing the Crown Jewels - but no one is prepared to believe a sinister billionaire is the culprit. Comedy, starring Rowan Atkinson, John Malkovich, Natalie Imbruglia and Ben Miller.(n)

programme.title: Mr Turner
programme.desc: Mike Leigh's biopic of the artist, following the last 25 years of his life. He faces losses in his personal life and declining health, but also embraces innovative new approaches to painting that provoke controversy in the arts establishment but lead to the creation of several masterpieces. Starring Timothy Spall and Paul Jesson.(n)

programme.title: Cheap Thrills
programme.desc: A man who has lost his job keeps his unemployment a secret from his family, but now faces losing their home. While he and a friend drown their sorrows, they are approached by a wealthy couple who offer the duo money if they will carry out a series of bizarre challenges. Comedy thriller, starring Pat Healy and Ethan Embry.(n)

programme.title: Barefoot Contessa
programme.desc: To celebrate her local florist's 20th anniversary, Ina Garten makes red pepper and gorgonzola bruschetta, chicken salad veronique and a chocolate cake.(n)

programme.title: Barefoot Contessa

programme.title: Barefoot Contessa
programme.desc: Ina Garten prepares grilled butterfly chicken, broccoli and tomato kebabs and a mixed berry pavlova.(n)

programme.title: Barefoot Contessa
programme.desc: Ina Garten makes lemon fusilli with arugula and panacotta with balsamic strawberries.(n)

programme.title: The Pioneer Woman
programme.desc: It is a big day of spring burning on the ranch, so Ree Drummond is preparing a Tex-Mex feast for her crew.(n)

programme.title: The Pioneer Woman
programme.desc: Ree Drummond and her daughter Paige prepare a care package full of mouthwatering dishes for Ladd's grandmother, Edna Mae.(n)

programme.title: The Pioneer Woman
programme.desc: Ree Drummond throws a surprise birthday lunch for her son Todd, including smashed burgers with onion strings and fry sauce, and chocolate brownies with strawberry and fudge sauces.(n)

programme.title: Jamie's 15 Minute Meals
programme.desc: Chef Jamie Oliver prepares more quick meals, including fish baps, mushy peas and tartare sauce, plus mushroom farfalle with blue cheese and a hazelnut and apple salad.(n)

programme.title: Jamie's 15 Minute Meals
programme.sub-title: Chicken Dim Sum and Crab Bricks.
programme.desc: Jamie Oliver is in the kitchen and he prepares chicken dim sum with coconut buns, cucumber pickle and hoi sin sauce, plus `crackin' crab briks', couscous salad and salsa.(n)

programme.title: Jamie's 15 Minute Meals
programme.desc: Chef Jamie Oliver demonstrates how to cook crispy duck and hoisin lettuce parcels, before preparing chicken cacciatore, spaghetti and smoky tomato sauce.(n)

programme.title: Jamie's 15 Minute Meals
programme.desc: The chef gets ready to provide more delicious recipes as quickly as possible, beginning with Moroccan bream accompanied by couscous salad, pomegranate and harissa, and British burgers with shred salad, pickles and stuffing.(n)

programme.title: Jamie's 15 Minute Meals
programme.desc: Chef Jamie Oliver prepares more quick meals, including his recipe for jerk pork with grilled corn and crunchy tortilla salad, as well as minestrone poached chicken and salsa verde.(n)

programme.title: Jamie's Great Escape
programme.desc: Jamie Oliver spends time at Farfa monastery in Lazio, living and working with the monks, who were the first people to collect recipes. However, on his arrival he finds the larder is empty and the herb garden for which the institution is famed has gone to seed. The tables are turned and the chef finds himself teaching once again.(n)

programme.title: Jamie's Great Escape
programme.desc: Jamie Oliver heads north to stay with a family of hunters in the mountains of Le Marche in Italy. He lives off the land, hunts for wild boar and learns how to make the perfect traditional ragu sauce. However, the chef is reduced to tears as he kills and butchers a lamb from the farm to provide for the family supper.(n)

programme.title: Man v Food

programme.title: Home Shopping
programme.desc: A chance to purchase goods from the comfort of home.(n)

programme.title: Cheers
programme.desc: Cliff's loyalties are divided when his postie girlfriend commits a mail offence on his behalf. Comedy, starring John Ratzenberger.(n)

programme.title: Cheers
programme.desc: Woody turns on the charm while serving at a party for Kelly, the beautiful daughter of a wealthy Cheers executive in a bid to win her affection. American comedy, guest starring Jackie Swanson, with Woody Harrelson and Ted Danson.(n)

programme.title: Cheers
programme.desc: Lilith and Frasier use Carla's six-year-old son as a subject on which to practise their parenting skills. Bar-room comedy, guest starring Jarrett Lennon, with Kelsey Grammer, Bebe Neuwirth and Rhea Perlman.(n)

programme.title: Blandings
programme.desc: Colonel Fanshawe calls to sound out Clarence as his successor as Lord Lieutenant of Shropshire, an honour for which Connie is desperate, prompting her to do everything in her power to impress their influential visitor. But what possible chance does she have when manservant Beach starts acting very oddly indeed? James Fleet guest stars.(n)

programme.title: Only Fools and Horses
programme.desc: Del snatches a chance to make a quick profit, leaving gullible Denzil stripped of his redundancy money. Comedy, starring David Jason, Nicholas Lyndhurst and Buster Merryfield.(n)

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.sub-title: Who Made a Bit of a Splash in Wales Then?.
programme.desc: Compo and Clegg gatecrash Foggy's trip to see a female friend in Wales. Comedy, starring Brian Wilde, Peter Sallis and Bill Owen.(n)

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.desc: The trio lament the lack of fresh vegetables available due to a shortage of `good honest muck' and wonder what it takes to find a half-decent carrot. Whimsical comedy, starring Peter Sallis, Brian Wilde and Bill Owen.(n)

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.desc: Amos Hames, an old friend of the trio's, reappears in the town after many years absence, arousing suspicion about the reasons for his return. Timothy Bateson guest stars in the whimsical comedy, with Peter Sallis, Bill Owen and Brian Wilde.(n)

programme.title: Boomers
programme.desc: Comedy following the ups and downs of three newly retired couples living in the Norfolk resort of Thurnemouth. The gang prepares for the funeral of old friend Jean, although Alan seems more interested that her ex-husband, his old pal Mick, is flying over from Spain for the service. John is wary of the visitor, convinced he has had a thing for his wife Maureen ever since a notorious holiday in Weymouth many moons ago. Meanwhile, Joyce is preoccupied with the thought of her daughter-in-law giving birth any day now. Philip Jackson, Alison Steadman, Russ Abbot, Stephanie Beacham, Paula Wilcox and James Smith star, with a guest appearance by Nigel Planer.(n)

programme.title: Only Fools and Horses
programme.desc: The first ever episode of John Sullivan's classic comedy, originally broadcast in 1981, which introduced the viewing public to the Trotter family. Rodney grows tired of being dogsbody to wheeler-dealing older brother Del-Boy and decides to set out on his own. David Jason and Nicholas Lyndhurst star, with Lennard Pearce.(n)

programme.title: Only Fools and Horses
programme.desc: Del and Rodney make a bit of cash on a used-car deal and decide to celebrate in style with a night out in the West End. Vintage comedy, starring David Jason, Nicholas Lyndhurst and Lennard Pearce.(n)

programme.title: Only Fools and Horses
programme.desc: Del gets his hands on a statue of a Hindu god - which plunges him into the middle of an age-old feud between rival families. Comedy, starring David Jason, Nicholas Lyndhurst and Lennard Pearce.(n)

programme.title: Only Fools and Horses
programme.desc: One of Del's old flames turns up out of the blue, so Rodney and Grandad resolve to extinguish any passion that might still be smouldering in the Peckham wide boy's heart. Vintage comedy, starring David Jason, Nicholas Lyndhurst and Lennard Pearce.(n)

programme.title: Only Fools and Horses
programme.desc: Del spots another sure-fire winner and decides to enter the highly profitable tourist trade - and with Rodney and Grandad backing him 100 per cent, he is sure his open-top bus tour initiative will be a massive success. Vintage comedy, starring David Jason, Nicholas Lyndhurst and Lennard Pearce.(n)

programme.title: Only Fools and Horses
programme.desc: Del-Boy acquires three tons of lead sheeting, which turns out to be a DIY nuclear fallout shelter, so he, Rodney and Grandad collect their sleeping bags and food and have a practice run to make sure they will know what to do if the Russians attack.(n)

programme.title: Only Fools and Horses
programme.sub-title: The Long Legs of the Law.
programme.desc: Rodney starts going out with a policewoman, much to the consternation of dodgy dealer Del-Boy, who is terrified that one wrong word from his little brother could see him banged up for five years. Vintage comedy, starring Nicholas Lyndhurst, David Jason and Lennard Pearce.(n)

programme.title: Only Fools and Horses
programme.desc: Del gets the chance to sell off a couple of antique urns - the only problem being that one of them contains the ashes of Trigger's late grandfather. Comedy, starring David Jason, Nicholas Lyndhurst, Lennard Pearce and Roger Lloyd Pack.(n)

programme.title: Only Fools and Horses
programme.desc: Del takes up cards in his latest bid to make his first million - much to the annoyance of Rodney and Grandad, who reckon he will end up gambling away all their worldly goods. Comedy with the wheeler-dealing Trotter family, starring David Jason, Nicholas Lyndhurst and Lennard Pearce.(n)

programme.title: Only Fools and Horses
programme.desc: Del-Boy cannot believe his ears when Rodney tells him he has found a girlfriend. The trouble is, the woman is old enough to be his mother - and to make matters worse, her husband is about to be released from prison.(n)

programme.title: Only Fools and Horses
programme.desc: Del jumps at the opportunity to decorate the local Chinese restaurant to make a quick profit, and the results are outstanding in more ways than one. Comedy, with David Jason, Nicholas Lyndhurst and Lennard Pearce.(n)

programme.title: Only Fools and Horses
programme.desc: Del and Rodney reluctantly agree to let Grandad accompany them on their holiday abroad - a decision they come to regret. Comedy, starring David Jason, Nicholas Lyndhurst and Lennard Pearce.(n)

programme.title: The Trip
programme.sub-title: The Trip to Italy: Il Cenobio dei Dogi, Camogli.
programme.desc: Sequel to improvised comedy The Trip, with Steve Coogan and Rob Brydon once again playing versions of themselves. The two comedy actors are asked to embark on another round of restaurant reviews for a Sunday newspaper, this time in Italy. Steve is on hiatus from his American TV series and isn't drinking while Rob is looking to unwind with his time away from his young family. They begin their trip in Piedmont at the Trattoria Della Posta before stopping at the poet Byron's former house in Genoa on their way to the Cenobio dei Dogi in Camogli. Michael Winterbottom directs.(n)

programme.title: The Trip
programme.sub-title: The Trip to Italy: Da Giovanni, San Fruttuoso.
programme.desc: Rob and Steve go on a boat trip, stopping off at the poet Shelley's house for a photo before continuing their journey and arriving at another restaurant. Rob goes for a walk on the beach with the woman running the excursion and asks how she ended up working on a boat in Italy, and confesses he is missing his young daughter. Comedy, starring Steve Coogan and Rob Brydon.(n)

programme.title: The Trip
programme.sub-title: The Trip to Italy: La Suvera, Pievescola.
programme.desc: Steve and Rob visit Viareggio in Tuscany, where the poet Shelley's body was washed ashore after he drowned, and have lunch at Trattoria Albana in Mazzolla. Later, Rob gets a phone call from his agent about a potential part in a film. Comedy, starring Steve Coogan and Rob Brydon.(n)

programme.title: Bottom
programme.desc: The grubby duo steal a car and discover the tickets for the unfortunate owner's honeymoon inside. Taking advantage of their find, they try to pass themselves off as the happy couple, but needless to say, the whole trip soon becomes a nightmare.(n)

programme.title: Bottom
programme.desc: Frustrated bachelors Richie and Eddie get their hands on a video camera following a spot of carnival-time looting, and decide to cash in by staging accidents and selling the tapes to a certain TV show. Comedy, starring Rik Mayall and Adrian Edmondson.(n)

programme.title: Bottom
programme.desc: Rik Mayall and Adrian Edmondson star in their 1997 stage show of the comedy, in which Richie and Eddie are marooned on a desert island with a nuclear bomb.(n)

programme.title: Bill Hicks: Sane Man
programme.desc: In this stand-up performance recorded in Texas in 1989, the American comedian subjects his caustic wit to subjects including smoking, drinking, drugs and his take on pop music. The act includes a comedic raunchy fantasy involving pop singers Debbie Gibson and Tiffany.(n)

programme.desc: A chance to purchase goods from the comfort of home.(n)

programme.title: Home Shopping
programme.desc: A chance to purchase goods from the comfort of home.(n)

programme.title: Cheers
programme.desc: Rebecca attempts to impress the corporate bigwigs by promoting Norm's painting business, while Sam's sporty girlfriend leaves him exhausted. Comedy, starring Ted Danson.(n)

programme.title: Cheers
programme.desc: Father-to-be Frasier decides whether to move into Lilith's rural retreat. Kelsey Grammer stars.(n)

programme.title: Only Fools and Horses
programme.desc: After lending assistance to a wealthy woman in distress, Del seizes a once-in-a-lifetime opportunity to improve his social standing by launching his own chandelier-cleaning business. As part of the venture, he ropes a reluctant Rodney and Grandad into helping him. David Jason and Nicholas Lyndhurst star.(n)

programme.title: Only Fools and Horses
programme.sub-title: Miami Twice - Part One: The American Dream.
programme.desc: Part one of two. The Trotters get a chance to escape Peckham for a holiday in the Florida sun - but it means Del leaving his newborn son behind. David Jason and Nicholas Lyndhurst star, with Buster Merryfield, Tessa Peake-Jones, Gwyneth Strong, Denis Lill and Roger Lloyd Pack.(n)

programme.title: Only Fools and Horses
programme.sub-title: Miami Twice - Part Two: Oh to Be in England.
programme.desc: Part two of two. The Trotters arrive in Florida, and walk straight into disaster after their camper van is burgled and local Mafiosi take a shine to Del-Boy, who bears more than a passing resemblance to their boss. What Del does not know is that they are planning to have him killed as a way of faking the godfather's death to help him escape being sent to prison. Feature-length episode of the comedy, starring David Jason and Nicholas Lyndhurst, with a cameo appearance by Bee Gee Barry Gibb.(n)

programme.title: The Trip
programme.sub-title: The Trip to Italy: Hotel Locarno, Rome.
programme.desc: Steve's assistant Emma joins him and Rob in Rome, where they also meet up with photographer Yolanda before visiting the Keats-Shelley Memorial House museum. They go on to their next restaurant, where Emma has a bit of news for them, and Rob and Steve compete with each other doing impressions of Marlon Brando's Don Corleone from The Godfather. Comedy, starring Steve Coogan and Rob Brydon.(n)

programme.title: The Trip
programme.sub-title: The Trip to Italy: Villa Cimbrone, Ravello.
programme.desc: Steve and Rob visit Pompeii and then have lunch at Relais Blu on the Sorrento coast, overlooking the isle of Capri. Continuing their journey by car they head to the next hotel, where Rob receives a call from his agent telling him he has got the part in the movie he auditioned for. Comedy, starring Steve Coogan and Rob Brydon.(n)

programme.title: The Trip
programme.sub-title: The Trip to Italy: Il Riccio, Capri.
programme.desc: Steve's son Joe and his assistant Emma join him and Rob on the final leg of their culinary tour of Italy as they take the ferry from Naples to Capri, where they have lunch at Il Riccio. Afterwards, Rob asks Emma for advice about whether he should go back to Lucy, while Steve tells Joe he is going to buy a house closer to him. Comedy, starring Steve Coogan and Rob Brydon.(n)

programme.title: The Thick of It
programme.desc: The unravelling of the key-worker housing sell-off policy forces both Nicola Murray and Peter Mannion onto the defensive, and thus begins a race for the moral high ground. But the more they try to spin the story, the bigger the scandal becomes, in an episode of the political comedy directed by Chris Addison (Olly Reeder). Rebecca Front, Roger Allam and Peter Capaldi co-star.(n)

programme.title: The Thick of It
programme.desc: Everyone has a lot of questions to answer about the suicide of the key worker after his flat was sold off - government, opposition and civil service alike. Heading the inquiry is Lord Goolding, who isn't going to stand for any nonsense. The truth is about to come out - unless someone lies, or creates a diversion of some kind, or simply pretends not to remember anything. Peter Capaldi stars.(n)

programme.title: MasterChef
programme.desc: The second lot of five hopefuls try their hand at professional service, preparing lunch at the Grain Store, a London restaurant overseen by classically trained chef Bruno Loubet. With paying customers to satisfy, they soon feel the weight of responsibility - who will rise to the challenge? The hopefuls then have a chance to show what they have learnt by rustling up a dish in an invention test, choosing from an array of seasonal produce - but in an unexpected twist, they also present their food to renowned chef Marcus Wareing. He then helps John Torode and Gregg Wallace evaluate the five amateurs before they decide which one has gone far enough in the competition.(n)

programme.title: MasterChef
programme.desc: It's the final episode of knockout week and the remaining eight hopefuls are all desperate to stay in the competition. There is just one challenge today - to create an unforgettable `showstopper' dish that will wow judges Gregg Wallace and John Torode and secure six of the cooks a place in the semi-finals. But they only have 90 minutes to create their masterpiece - so the race is on.(n)

programme.title: Food & Drink
programme.desc: Host Michel Roux Jr is joined by MasterChef judge and former greengrocer Gregg Wallace to create a meal in which vegetables are the main focus and meat is just the garnish, and resident drinks expert Kate Goodman selects white wines from Portugal that are a perfect match for the food. Plus, chef Florence Knight shows how to cook a little-known by-product of garlic.(n)

programme.title: Two Greedy Italians
programme.sub-title: Two Greedy Italians: Still Hungry: Calabria and Bambinone.
programme.desc: Antonio Carluccio and Gennaro Contaldo return to Italy, where they continue their culinary journey. They begin in the southern region of Calabria, where they reminisce about their favourite childhood meals. Antonio reveals the secret of his hot packed-lunches while Gennaro shares his memories of the ritual pig kill. Featuring recipes for orzotto - a pork and pearl barley risotto - fish stew, and rice cake flavoured with orange.(n)

programme.title: Rachel Allen: Home Cooking
programme.desc: Rachel demonstrates how to make nougat, salmon fish fingers and crispy chicken goujons, and meets Michelin-starred chef Anthony Demetre to find out what is on his French-influenced menu at home.(n)

programme.title: Rachel Allen: Home Cooking
programme.desc: Rachel prepares fish and chips with home-made tartare sauce, and demonstrates recipes for popcorn toppings, healthy vegetable crisps and lemonade. She also travels to Wales to meet Michelin-starred chef Stephen Terry and helps him make a family brunch using local produce.(n)

programme.title: My Kitchen
programme.desc: Antonio Carluccio prepares tuna-stuffed eggs, rocket salad and soupy pasta with potatoes.(n)

programme.title: My Kitchen
programme.desc: Antonio Carluccio prepares comfort food, including chanterelle soup, Ischia-style rabbit casserole, and pickled mushrooms.(n)

programme.title: Two Greedy Italians
programme.sub-title: Two Greedy Italians: Still Hungry: Liguria and la Bella Figura.
programme.desc: Antonio Carluccio and Gennaro Contaldo search for the meaning of the Italian phrase `la bella figura' - making the best of yourself. They find a culture of admiration for the superficial in Portofino and set off around the coastal Liguria region in search of something more meaningful, and find what they are looking for in a priest working with social outcasts. Along the way they discover a 50 euro olive oil and the Cucina Bianca of Mendatica.(n)

programme.title: You Gotta Eat Here
programme.desc: Comedian John Catucci samples boar and buffalo burgers and a crab club sandwich.(n)

programme.title: You Gotta Eat Here
programme.desc: John Catucci visits the Boxwood Cafe in Calgary to sample some Belgian fries. He also visits an oyster house.(n)

programme.title: You Gotta Eat Here
programme.desc: Crepes are next on the menu for John Catucci as the comedian visits Kawaii Crepe in Winnipeg, before he heads to a roadside stop in Ontario and a Polish eatery in Victoria.(n)

programme.title: You Gotta Eat Here
programme.desc: Toronto offers John Catucci a pasta fix, before the comedian heads to quirky eateries in Montreal and Vancouver.(n)

programme.title: You Gotta Eat Here
programme.sub-title: Rangoli, Lancaster Smokehouse, The Big Orange Lunchbox.
programme.desc: Comedian John Catucci embarks on another tour of culinary Canada, sampling Indian comfort curries, Southern smokehouse meats and `triple threat' burgers.(n)

programme.title: You Gotta Eat Here
programme.desc: John Catucci tries a `Dirty Bourbon Burger' and an aubergine and parmesan sandwich, and learns about the perfect pizza crust.(n)

programme.title: Two Greedy Italians
programme.sub-title: Two Greedy Italians: Still Hungry: The Alps and Arrangiarsi.
programme.desc: Antonio Carluccio and Gennaro Contaldo head to the central Alps to learn the enterprising food skills of the Lombards. Making do with whatever ingredients they find for free along the way, the duo rustle up a chestnut gnocchi, and also work for butter and bresaola - thinly sliced dried beef - which they use for a salad. Also featuring recipes for Alpine pizza and pizzoccheri pasta.(n)

programme.title: Two Greedy Italians
programme.sub-title: Two Greedy Italians: Still Hungry: Rome and Lazio and Machismo.
programme.desc: Chefs Antonio Carluccio and Gennaro Contaldo compare the traditional role of men in the mountain villages of Lazio to that of their counterparts in Rome. In the capital, the duo find that the masculine model of their youth is outworn, and discover that men are now willing to take on chores that were once considered outside their domain - including cooking. Featuring recipes for braised beef in red wine, sweet pepper omelette and bucatini pasta with bacon and chilli.(n)
