programme.title: The Supersizers Eat
programme.desc: Giles Coren and Sue Perkins sample the cuisine of revolutionary France during the 1870s. After devouring a hefty 5,000-calorie breakfast, Sue tastes a broth like the one served to Marie Antoinette prior to her execution, while Giles tries the latest vegetable - the potato. Later, critic Grimod de la Reyniere treats the pair to a meal to honour the advent of the restaurant.(n)

programme.title: The Supersizers Eat
programme.desc: The duo embark on a culinary journey through the 1920s, as Sue Perkins transforms into an `It' girl and Giles Coren dons full dandyish attire to drink cocktails at The Ritz, dance the Charleston at the Cafe de Paris and race Bentleys at Brooklands. They also sample a gourmet Fortnum & Mason picnic at the British Museum and join Celia Walden, Diana Quick, Lord Ponsonby and David Taylor for a spectacular end-of-week meal.(n)

programme.title: Luke Nguyen's Street Food Asia
programme.desc: The chef travels to countries around the continent to explore their thriving street food cultures, beginning with the first of two programmes from Saigon in Vietnam.(n)

programme.title: Luke Nguyen's Street Food Asia
programme.desc: Part two of two. Luke continues his Saigon adventure, uncovering a dispute between sisters with competing food stalls and cooking spicy chilli crab claws.(n)

programme.title: Luke Nguyen's Street Food Asia
programme.desc: Part one of two. The chef heads to Bangkok in Thailand, stumbling across hidden stalls and enjoying the traditional Thai dessert of coconut pudding.(n)

programme.title: Luke Nguyen's Street Food Asia
programme.desc: Part two of two. Luke heads through the back streets of Bangkok, searching for the best tom yum soup and making fresh dancing shrimp salad.(n)

programme.desc: Part two of two. Luke continues unearthing different street foods in Kuala Lumpur, starting at the central Jalan Imbi market and sampling pork bone soup.(n)

programme.title: The Happening
programme.desc: Lady in the Water director M. Night Shyamalan puts PG-13 suspense on pause to tell this grim apocalyptic tale about a family fleeing a natural disaster that poses a grave threat to the whole of humanity. Philadelphia high-school science teacher Elliot Moore (Mark Wahlberg) is discussing the disappearance of the bees with his students when the staff is summoned to the theater and briefed about a mysterious event that is currently unfolding in New York City. According to reports, citizens in the vicinity of Central Park have suddenly and inexplicably begun seizing up just before killing themselves by whatever means are at their disposal. As the phenomena begins to spread and talk of terrorism fills the airwaves, Elliot, his wife, Alma (Zooey Deschanel), their friend Julian (John Leguizamo), and his daughter, Jess (Ashlyn Sanchez), board a train bound for the presumed safety of the country. When the train screeches to a halt before arriving at its final destination, however, the frightened passengers are forced to fend for themselves as each consecutive news report paints an increasingly grim picture of the situation in more urbanized areas. Theories abound on what could be causing the unexplainable rash of suicides, but the only thing that everyone seems to agree on is that it's some kind of airborne contagion that is carried in the wind. It would appear that humankind's reign on planet Earth has come to an end, but perhaps if this small band of survivors can find a safe place to lie low until this all blows over, all hope for survival of the species might not be lost just yet(n)

programme.title: Rendition
programme.desc: The director of the Academy Award-winning 2006 crime drama Tsotsi returns to the helm with this tale of a Middle East CIA operative who begins to have doubts about his latest assignment after witnessing the interrogation of a suspected suicide bomber by secret police. When Egyptian-born chemical engineer Anwar El-Ibrahimi (Omar Metwally) mysteriously vanishes on a routine flight from South Africa to Washington, his wife, Isabella (Reese Witherspoon), embarks on a frantic international search for her missing husband. At the same time, a CIA analyst (Jake Gyllenhaal) arrives at a clandestine detention facility outside of United States. As the interrogation of El-Ibrahimi gets under way, the CIA analyst is profoundly shaken by the unorthodox methods used by the man's captors, and quickly begins to reevaluate his assignment. Peter Sarsgaard, Meryl Streep, and Alan Arkin co-star in this topical political thriller penned by Kelley Sane and produced by Steve Golin(n)

programme.title: Mr. Baseball
programme.desc: An ailing baseball player accepts a transfer to Japan and experiences a severe culture shock in this sports comedy(n)

programme.title: The Cowboy Way

programme.title: Brooklyn
programme.desc: A meek young woman emigrates from Ireland to New York City in the 1950s, and finds her heart torn between a magnetic Italian suitor and a charming lad back home in this nostalgic and moving romance(n)

programme.title: Making of 'The Danish Girl'
programme.desc: A look at "The Danish Girl," a 2015 adaptation of David Ebershoff's novel about early 20th-century Danish painter Einar Wegener, who was one of the first people to have sex-reassignment surgery. The film stars Eddie Redmayne, Alicia Vikander and Matthias Schoenaerts, and is directed by Tom Hooper(n)

programme.title: The Danish Girl
programme.desc: A Swedish man opts for a sex change and undergoes the world's first gender reassignment surgery, but his marriage suffers as his artist wife struggles with the transition(n)

programme.title: Crimson Peak
programme.desc: In this gothic romance set at the turn of the 20th century, a mysterious stranger named Sir Thomas Sharpe (Tom Hiddleston) woos young author Edith Cushing (Mia Wasikowska) and brings her as his bride to his mansion atop a clay mountain in Cumbria, England. There, Edith meets Sharpe's strange and secretive sister Lucille (Jessica Chastain), and learns that her new home holds many disturbing secrets that will force her to fight for her sanity and her very life. Directed by Guillermo del Toro(n)

programme.desc: A typical day in the life of Craig, an alright guy with some crazy friends. Like Smokey, who has 24 hours to pay back Deebo, South Central's nastiest thug - or else. Trouble is, neither Craig's mother nor his main squeeze have the cash. As time ticks away, the chance this pair will ever see Saturday is fading fast(n)

programme.title: Puerto Ricans in Paris
programme.desc: Two Puerto Rican NYC cops are asked by a pair of French fashion designers to come to Paris to hunt down the counterfeiters who stole a couture handbag(n)

programme.title: Legal Eagles
programme.desc: Courtroom adversaries become allies to defend a spaced-out murder suspect(n)

programme.title: Casper
programme.desc: Greedy heiress Carrigan Crittenden inherits the haunted Whipstaff Manor and discovers that the house contains a treasure, which is closely guarded by three nasty ghosts. She invites ghost therapist Dr. James Harvey, and his daughter Kat, to move into the eerie mansion and get rid of the supernatural creatures(n)

programme.title: Romancing the Stone
programme.desc: In this film, adventure writer Kathleen Turner learns that her sister is being held prisoner by evil art dealers in Colombia. It seems that sis has mailed Turner a map leading to a valuable treasure. In her search for the treasure, Turner teams up with soldier of fortune Michael Douglas(n)

programme.title: Bustin' Loose
programme.desc: Richard Pryor is a con man maneuvered into working with disturbed kids. Cicely Tyson, Robert Christian. Martin: Alphonso Alexander. Samantha: Kia Cooper. Ernesto: Edwin DeLeon. Pryor produced and co-wrote the story(n)

programme.title: Bridget Jones: The Edge of Reason
programme.desc: "The question is what happens AFTER you walk off into the sunset," is the poser Bridget Jones is fretting over after snaring Mark Darcy. On the plus side, there's been a romantically-blissful six weeks of seventy-one "ecstatic shags" with the mega-mannered human rights lawyer. But on the downside, Bridget still needs a calculator to calorie count and feels ill-at-ease in Darcy's world of soaring legal eagles and black-tie dinners(n)

programme.title: Meet Dave
programme.desc: A crew of miniature aliens operate a spaceship that has a human form. While trying to save their planet, the aliens encounter a new problem, as their ship becomes smitten with an Earth woman(n)

programme.title: Mafia!
programme.desc: Packed to the gills with references to mob movies from The Godfather to Casino, the story of an Italian boy who comes to America and becomes entangled with the all-powerful Mafia provides on opportunity for director Jim Abrahams to poke fun at the genre in his distinctive gag-a-minute style using everything from visual puns to verbal acrobatics in his quest to raise a laugh. The gags come thick and fast in this Mafia spoof from the makers of Airplane! and The Naked Gun(n)

programme.title: Keanu
programme.desc: Two straight-laced friends pose as drug dealers and try their best -- and sometimes fail -- to fit in with the thug circle in order to retrieve a stolen kitten(n)

programme.title: Sisters
programme.desc: Two adult sisters throw one last raging party in their childhood home before it's sold by their parents, with disastrous results(n)

programme.title: Bridget Jones: The Edge of Reason
programme.desc: "The question is what happens AFTER you walk off into the sunset," is the poser Bridget Jones is fretting over after snaring Mark Darcy. On the plus side, there's been a romantically-blissful six weeks of seventy-one "ecstatic shags" with the mega-mannered human rights lawyer. But on the downside, Bridget still needs a calculator to calorie count and feels ill-at-ease in Darcy's world of soaring legal eagles and black-tie dinners(n)

programme.title: The Wedding Singer
programme.desc: Adam Sandler and Drew Barrymore pair up for this tuneful romcom. Waitress Julia and failed songwriter Robbie are engaged to be married. But unfortunately, not to one another(n)

programme.title: Little Nicky
programme.desc: The Lord of Darkness wants to retire but none of his three sons seems good enough for the job. When he decides he will not cede his throne to any of them, the two most powerful ones escape to Earth to create a kingdom for themselves. This action closes the portal filtering sinful souls to Hell and causes Satan to begin withering away. Now it's up to the weak but beloved Nicky to save his dad and the humankind before one of his brothers becomes the new Satan(n)

programme.title: Gentlemen Broncos
programme.desc: This lovable, offbeat comedy centers on sad-sack teenager Benjamin (Michael Angarano), who attends a writing workshop to pursue his dream of becoming a fantasy novelist. However, a famous author (Jemaine Clement) at the workshop steals his material. Directed by Jared Hess. Jennifer Coolidge, Sam Rockwell, Mike White(n)

programme.title: Crooklyn
programme.desc: Spike Lee and his siblings Cinque Lee and Joie Lee co-wrote this nostalgic but unglamorized look at a family growing up in Brooklyn in the 1970s, inspired by their own childhood. Woody Carmichael (Delroy Lindo) is a jazz musician whose career is in a slump; he once made a good living as a session musician, but he has moved away from it to devote himself to more serious music, a choice that has not worked out well from a financial standpoint. His wife Carolyn (Alfre Woodard) works as a school teacher to keep food on the table. The Carmichaels have five children, a bright and introspective daughter named Troy (Zelda Harris) and four sons with a habit of causing trouble, and they all share an apartment in a brownstone in Brooklyn. Crooklyn follows the Carmichaels as the kids learn the funny and painful lessons of growing up, Mom and Dad balance their love for each other against the financial and personal difficulties of the creative life, and they all try to get along with the often eccentric neighbors on their block. Crooklyn's soundtrack is enlivened by classic 70s R&B hits, including selections by Sly and the Family Stone, The Jackson Five, Curtis Mayfield, The Staple Singers, and The Chambers Brothers(n)

programme.title: Life with Mikey
programme.desc: Mikey used to be a child star. These days, he's just a talent scout looking for kids with prospects, until pint-sized Angie picks his pocket. Mikey hears her sob story and sees his ticket back to the big time. Family comedy(n)

programme.title: Ernest Scared Stupid
programme.desc: Ernest P. Worrell (Jim Varney) unleashes a troll from a curse. Eartha Kitt. Kenny: Austin Nagler. Elizabeth: Shay Astar. Trantor: Jonas Moscartolo. Tom: John Cadenhead. Bobby: Bill Byrge. Matt: Richard Woolf. Directed by John Cherry(n)

programme.title: The World According to Garp
programme.desc: Garp's an aspiring novelist, who's mother, Jenny is, an unmarried, unorthodox, feminist. Garp succeeds in publishing his novel, at the same time that his mother publishes her first feminist manifesto. Though successful and happily married to his college sweetheart, Helen, Garp still envys his fearless mother(n)

programme.title: Ride Along 2
programme.desc: Friction continues between a rookie cop and his seasoned partner (who's also his future brother-in-law). After discovering a mysterious flash drive during an arrest, the pair travel to Miami to hunt down a drug lord with the help of a savvy detective(n)

programme.title: Hairspray
programme.desc: Adam Shankman's adaptation of the 2005 musical stars John Travolta, Queen Latifah and Nikki Blonsky. Teen Tracy Turnblad's regular cultural highlight is a local television music and dance programme called The Corny Collins Show. And, like all her friends, she dreams of having a chance to appear on it. However, this is Baltimore and it is 1962 - and Tracy's both overweight and, worse, has liberal attitudes to race relations, which don't sit comfortably with the segregationist views of the show's producer. But, could Tracy's ambitions for not only appearing on the show, but also racially integrating it, receive a fillip when she meets the son of Motormouth Maybelle, host of the monthly 'Negro Day' edition of the show?(n)

programme.title: Making of 'Ride Along 2'
programme.desc: A look at "Ride Along 2," a 2016 comedy that follows an aspiring cop and his veteran partner—and future brother-in-law—as they pursue a Miami drug lord. The sequel to the 2014 hit stars Ice Cube, Kevin Hart and Benjamin Bratt, and is directed by Tim Story(n)

programme.title: P.S. I Love You
programme.desc: Hilary Swank adds another outstanding characterization to her Oscar-winning résumé. She plays Holly Kennedy, a young widow whose late husband (Gerard Butler) arranged to have 10 letters delivered posthumously to encourage her to carry on with her life. Directed by Richard LaGravenese, who cowrote the moving script with Steven Rogers. The film is an adaptation of Cecelia Ahern's popular first novel, which she wrote when she was 21(n)

programme.title: Rocket Science
programme.desc: Jeffrey Blitz's seriocomedy Rocket Science proves that many a handicap can be overcome, no matter how daunting the obstacle at hand may initially seem. Newcomer Reece Thompson plays Hal Hefner, a 15-year-old high-school student with a minor yet socially alienating (and painful) disability: he stutters uncontrollably. Determined to work through the problem, Hal opts for an extreme route -- he joins the school debating team, which sends him on a headfirst plunge into breakneck speech competitions -- and offers a much-needed boost toward correcting the problem. Blitz, like his onscreen alter ego, struggled with a stammer as a young man -- a disability he eventually surmounted -- which imparted him with a lifelong interest in speech and storytelling(n)

programme.title: How to Be Single
programme.desc: In this hilarious and heartfelt rom com, four women with vastly different ideas about love and relationships navigate the single life of New York City. Two friends set out on a journey of self-discovery, while a career gal struggles with settling down and an uptight romantic searches for her perfect match(n)

programme.title: Ride Along 2
programme.desc: Friction continues between a rookie cop and his seasoned partner (who's also his future brother-in-law). After discovering a mysterious flash drive during an arrest, the pair travel to Miami to hunt down a drug lord with the help of a savvy detective(n)

programme.title: Do the Right Thing
programme.desc: A local black community is unhappy that their community is effectively being run by whites. As the heat rises on a hot summer's day in Brooklyn, so the racial tension, which has so far lay dormant under the surface, begins to rise(n)

programme.title: P.S. I Love You
programme.desc: Hilary Swank adds another outstanding characterization to her Oscar-winning résumé. programme.title: Citizen U.S.A.: A 50 State Road Trip
programme.desc: Alexandra Pelosi's patriotic travelogue crisscrosses the U.S. to attend naturalization ceremonies in all 50 states and listens to recent immigrants from around the world explain their decision to become American citizens. The film is inspired by the naturalization process experienced by Pelosi's Dutch-born husband, Michiel Vos, and includes remarks by former secretaries of state Madeleine Albright and Henry Kissinger, commentator Arianna Huffington, and rock star Gene Simmons(n)

programme.desc: The Clown Prince of Crime returns to Gotham to terrorise Bruce Wayne. Meanwhile, Terry tries to uncover secrets in Bruce's past that may lead to defeating the Joker for good(n)

programme.desc: A high-school student wants to become a champion figure skater, but her mother wants her to go to Harvard(n)

She puts her plan in motion with the help of two friends---a computer geek (Corbin Bleu) and a mechanical wiz (Max Thieriot). Jennifer Beals(n)

programme.title: Journey to the Center of the Earth
programme.desc: Henry Levin's glorious adventure movie, inspired by the Jules Verne novel, stars James Mason as Professor Oliver Lindenbrook, who embarks on an expedition to the centre of the planet a world of prehistoric beasts, rock falls, scorching heat and lethal winds, accompanied by murderous attempts on the explorers' lives. But will his team, including student Alec McKuen and glamorous widow Carla Göteborg, ever be able to return?(n)

programme.title: Joy
programme.desc: Biopic of entrepreneur Joy Mangano (Jennifer Lawrence), a divorced mother of two who risks her life's savings to produce and market her invention, the Miracle Mop. Joy faces opposition from her dysfunctional family, including her father Rudy (Robert De Niro), as they meddle in her burgeoning business. But when the head of the newly founded QVC network (Bradley Cooper) gives her a chance to sell her product on live TV, the Miracle Mop becomes a household name. The success of that invention later leads to a home-shopping empire and Joy's ascension to the matriarch of her extended family. David O. Russell directed this briskly paced comedy-drama, with Diane Ladd, Virginia Madsen, Isabella Rossellini, and Elisabeth Röhm co-starring(n)

African-American Jackie Robinson breaks Major League Baseball's colour barrier when he is signed to the Brooklyn Dodgers by the team's forward-thinking general manager, Branch Rickey. programme.desc: Ray Lawrence's assured, fascinating film appears, on the surface, to be a murder mystery - a corpse is found and cop Anthony LaPaglia is on the case. But he faces personal problems with his wife Kerry Armstrong who is seeing psychiatrist Barbara Hershey who is having her own problems with her husband, Geoffrey Rush. Comparable to Magnolia and Short Cuts, this is a multi-layered film about relationships and power as much as the murder(n)

programme.title: The Huntsman: Winter's War
programme.desc: This exhilarating spin-off of "Snow White and the Huntsman" acts as both prequel and sequel to the original film, detailing the adventures of Eric the Huntsman as he gets caught up in the rivalry between wicked queens Ravenna and Freya. During his quest, Eric is also endangered by his feelings for fellow warrior Sara, since ice queen Freya has decreed that love is forbidden in her kingdom(n)

programme.title: The Sixth Sense
programme.desc: The story of an eight-year-old boy with a dark secret - he sees ghosts - and the psychologist who tries to help him discover what is behind the disturbances(n)

programme.title: Insidious: Chapter 3
programme.desc: Gifted psychic Elise Rainier contacts the dead, when a teenage girl is in supernatural trouble(n)

programme.title: The Forest
programme.desc: In this haunting thriller, a young woman searches for her twin sister in an infamous Japanese forest beneath Mount Fuji where lost souls go to commit suicide. With the help of an American guide, she treks into the heart of the mysterious woodland(n)

programme.title: Haiku Tunnel
programme.desc: A temp worker is promoted to permanent status and finds his whole world changing as a result in this satiric comedy. Josh (Josh Kornbluth) is an overstuffed aspiring writer who is trying to finish his first novel, but in the meantime he supports himself by working as an office temp. Josh has grown accustomed to the Byzantine world of temporary labor, particularly the bossy secretaries and chilly co-workers, but Josh manages to impress his latest employers enough that they offer to make him a permanent, full-time employee. While a fellow temp who worked for the same company warns Josh that taking the job would be a mistake, Josh takes the plunge anyway, and soon discovers that his fellow employees now embrace him as one of their own. He also discovers that Bob Shelby (Warren Keith), his new boss, is more than a little crazy, and when Bob gives Josh an assignment to mail a series of important letters, John finds that he's suddenly incapable of doing this seemingly simple task. Instead, Josh spends his days working on his book (on company time and on a company computer), with his fellow office drones offering emphatic encouragement. Josh Kornbluth adapted Haiku Tunnel (with the help of John Bellucci and Jacob Kornbluth) from a semi-improvised one-man show Kornbluth created with David Ford; the Kornbluth brothers also directed the film(n)

programme.title: Jeepers Creepers
programme.desc: Victor Salva's superior horror film stars Gina Philips and Justin Long as bickering siblings driving from college across America. Pulling over to investigate a parked truck that had previously tried to run them off the road, they see a strangely garbed figure dumping what looks like a dead body. Investigating, they stumble across an ancient, indestructible horror and look set to become the next victims, unless the advice of psychic Patricia Belcher can save them(n)

programme.title: Self/less
programme.desc: A dying New York real-estate tycoon undergoes a top-secret procedure to transfer his consciousness into the body of a healthy young man, but he discovers that his new life isn't what he expected after severing ties to his old one and learning about the mysterious origins of his new body(n)

She's been trafficking "hot" money for gangster Ordell Robbie (Samuel L Jackson), but when she finds she's carrying enough for retirement she decides to fly solo, so long as she can keep him, the local cops and the feds convinced of her honesty(n)

His investigation reveals an unsettling coverup and conspiracy, pitting him against the ruthless government agents behind it(n)

programme.title: Cocoon

It's not long before he realizes that the pods have been put there by the same strangers who have asked to use his boat - strangers who then reveal themselves to be aliens from another planet(n)

programme.title: Hairspray
programme.desc: Adam Shankman's adaptation of the 2005 musical stars John Travolta, Queen Latifah and Nikki Blonsky. Teen Tracy Turnblad's regular cultural highlight is a local television music and dance programme called The Corny Collins Show. And, like all her friends, she dreams of having a chance to appear on it. However, this is Baltimore and it is 1962 - and Tracy's both overweight and, worse, has liberal attitudes to race relations, which don't sit comfortably with the segregationist views of the show's producer. But, could Tracy's ambitions for not only appearing on the show, but also racially integrating it, receive a fillip when she meets the son of Motormouth Maybelle, host of the monthly 'Negro Day' edition of the show?(n)

programme.title: Old School

programme.title: Fool's Gold
programme.desc: Andy Tennant's comedy adventure stars Matthew McConaughey as Benjamin Finnegan, a treasure hunter who finally pins down the Carribbean location of a sunken Spanish galleon loaded with gold. He convinces his ex-wife Tess to use her persuasive powers to get her boss Nigel Honeycutt to lend him his luxury cruiser to use to dive for the treasure. But as they head out to the wreck, they have to beat Benjamin's mentor Moe Fitch and gangster rapper Bigg Bunny, who also have designs on the gold. Edited for language(n)

programme.title: Demolition
programme.desc: Davis Mitchell (Jake Gyllenhaal) has a comfortable life as a Wall Street investment banker, but it's brought to an abrupt halt when his wife is killed in a car accident. As he struggles to move on from this tragedy, he reflects on the stagnant marriage he had with his late spouse. He also becomes obsessed with dismantling the machines surrounding him as a coping mechanism, and begins a relationship with a customer-service representative for a vending-machine company (Naomi Watts) after sending them multiple complaint letters. Director Jean-Marc Vallée directed this black dramedy, which made its world premiere at the 2015 Toronto International Film Festival(n)

programme.title: The Boss
programme.desc: Hugely successful businesswoman Michelle Darnell (Melissa McCarthy) is convicted of insider trading and sentenced to prison. programme.title: Catch Me if You Can
programme.desc: Frank Abagnale, Jr worked as a doctor, a lawyer and as a co-pilot for a major airline - all before his 18th birthday. A master of deception, he was also a brilliant forger whose skill gave him his first real claim to fame. At the age of 17, Frank became the most successful bank robber in the history of the United States. programme.title: The Prestige
programme.desc: Obsession, jealousy, and deceit define the tense relationship shared between two turn-of-the-century magicians in Memento and Batman Begins director Christopher Nolan's dizzying tale of sleight of hand. Rupert Angier (Hugh Jackman) and Alfred Borden (Christian Bale) are London-based magicians of the highest order, both blessed with spectacular powers of deception and both cursed with unrelenting envy for one another's skills. When Alfred performs an awe-inspiring trick for which there seems no logical explanation, the friendly competition shared between the pair turns to deadly rivalry as the enraged Rupert determines to uncover his rival's deepest secrets. In the world of illusion, however, nothing is ever quite as it seems, and the rules of the physical world simply don't apply. Now, as bitter competition quickly begins to consume the souls of both performers, the firestorm birthed by their anger threatens to consume all who surround them. Michael Caine, Scarlett Johansson, and David Bowie co-star in a feature that finds director/screenwriter Nolan reuniting with brother and Memento story author Jonathan Nolan to adapt author Christopher Priest's original novel(n)

programme.title: Watchmen
programme.desc: In an alternate 1985 where former superheroes exist, the murder of a colleague sends active vigilante Rorschach into his own sprawling investigation, uncovering something that could completely change the course of history as we know it(n)

programme.title: Troy

programme.title: Exodus: Gods and Kings
programme.desc: Ridley Scott's Biblical epic Exodus: Gods and Kings stars Christian Bale as Moses who, as the film opens, fights alongside his brother Ramses (a shaved-headed Joel Edgerton), to help defend Egypt, which is ruled by their father, Seti (John Turturro). During battle, Moses saves Ramses life, causing Ramses to fear that his brother will one day be King because it fits with a prophecy handed down by one of Seti's trusted spiritualists. Soon after Seti's death, Moses, who is actually Jewish and not Egyptian, is banished. However, he becomes the leader of the Jewish people and leads a rebellion, with the help of a wrathful God, against that Egyptians(n)

programme.title: Lethal Weapon
programme.desc: New series. Action drama based on the film franchise. Grief-stricken after the loss of his wife and unborn child, ex-Navy Seal-turned-detective Martin Riggs moves to California to start afresh at the LAPD. He's paired up with veteran detective Roger Murtaugh, who's just coming back to the job after a near-fatal heart attack. Riggs' penchant for diving headfirst into the line of fire soon clashes with Murtaugh's prudent by-the-book technique and his life-on-the-edge attitude makes him a priority case for the department's psychologist. Clayne Crawford and Damon Wayans star.(n)

programme.sub-title: Gino's Italian Escape: Hidden Italy: Piedmont.
programme.desc: Gino D'Acampo explores Piedmont, a northern region that borders France and Switzerland and sits at the foot of the Alps. It is known for sophisticated cuisine and wines such as barolo, but it is also home to a truffle festival in the town of Alba, where Gino meets a man whose job is to hunt for the delicacies with his trusty four-legged friend. Piedmont is at the heart of the Italian rice production and Gino tries his hand at rice harvesting and cooks a meal that celebrates the Po Valley area. Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: Chopping Block
programme.desc: Four competitive couples face three culinary challenges on the theme of pub favourites set by chef Rosemary Shrager and expert baker John Whaite, including fish and chips, and a Bakewell tart. One pair will face elimination from the contest at the end of the show.(n)

programme.title: Who's Doing the Dishes
programme.desc: Former Emmerdale actress Deena Payne puts on a dinner party for four strangers, who have to work out the identity of their mystery celebrity host with the help of a few cryptic clues - otherwise they will be doing the washing up. Hosted by Brian McFadden.(n)

programme.title: The Voice UK
programme.desc: The contest switches gear once again, as the battle phase comes to an end and the contestants face the first of the live knock-out shows, in which they must perform not only for the coaches, but also for the viewers at home. This time, Jennifer Hudson's six remaining acts are whittled down to three, as they sing for her and fellow coaches Will.i.am, Tom Jones and Gavin Rossdale. However, this time, the coaches' role is purely observational, as the public vote determines which performers will be taking one step closer to stardom.(n)

programme.title: Little Big Shots
programme.desc: Dawn French hosts a variety show featuring some of the world's most talented children. This episode features seven-year-old Shaolin kung fu performer Junayde, Filipino internet sensation and dancer Balang, and a young piano maestro.(n)

programme.title: The Chase
programme.desc: Bradley Walsh presents as four contestants pit their wits against ruthless quiz genius the Chaser in the hope of winning a potential prize pot worth thousands of pounds. They work as a team and play strategically to answer general knowledge questions against the clock and race down the game board to the exit without being caught.(n)

programme.title: Tipping Point
programme.desc: Game show, hosted by Ben Shephard, in which contestants answer questions to win turns on an arcade-style machine. Dropping tokens down a choice of four chutes, they hope to knock piles of them off a moving shelf - and the more they collect, the greater the prize fund. The player who has won the least amount is then eliminated, and the last one standing competes for a £10,000 jackpot.(n)

programme.title: Harry Hill's Alien Fun Capsule
programme.desc: Madcap panel show presented by the comedian, who presides over two teams nominally tasked with saving the planet from any potential alien invasion. The first episode features panellists Kathy Burke, Lorraine Kelly, Ainsley Harriott and Joe Lycett, who must find clips, people and anything that is fun or funny enough for Harry to place in the capsule which, in the event that the planet is invaded by aliens, can be presented to them to demonstrate earthlings are good fun and therefore worthy of saving.(n)

programme.title: Five Gold Rings
programme.desc: New series. Game show, hosted by Phillip Schofield, in which contestants compete to answer visual questions by placing rings on an LED floor in five increasingly difficult stages. In the first episode, a couple take on a mother and daughter for the £25,000 grand prize. Viewers can play along using the series app.(n)

programme.title: The Voice UK
programme.desc: The second of five live knockout shows, which sees three of Tom Jones' remaining acts eliminated from the contest, while the other three go through to a place in the quarter final. The public vote will decide who gets to stay on, while Tom has the option to save one of his acts. As well as her regular coaching duties, Jennifer Hudson will also be performing live in the studio.(n)

programme.title: The Good Karma Hospital
programme.desc: Lydia and Ruby visit a convent to make a seemingly miraculous diagnosis, but the treatment of a young nun and the senior doctor's interfering attitude creates tension between them, which finally erupts in a fierce confrontation. Maggie and Paul join a group of pilgrims on a trek through the jungle, hoping to find the answer to their prayers. Guest starring Madhur Jaffrey.(n)

programme.title: The Nightly Show
programme.desc: New series. Compilation of highlights of the first week of the entertainment show, featuring David Walliams as the host and a mix of topical monologues, studio games, celebrity guests, stand-up and video clips.(n)

programme.title: Peston on Sunday
programme.desc: Political magazine, presented by Robert Peston, with ITV News National Editor Allegra Stratton. Featuring reports on the latest issues and interviews with topical guests.(n)

programme.title: Premiership Rugby Union
programme.desc: Mark Durden-Smith and David Flatman present action from the 17th round of fixtures, including Leicester Tigers v Exeter Chiefs, Bath v Wasps, and Newcastle Falcons v Saracens.(n)

programme.title: Totally Bonkers Guinness World Records
programme.desc: Matt Edmondson narrates a selection of some of the most incredible and peculiar record-breaking attempts.(n)

programme.title: Emmerdale
programme.desc: Long-running soap following the ups and downs of village life amid the rolling scenery of the Yorkshire Dales.(n)

programme.title: Coronation Street
programme.desc: Long-running drama with the residents of England's most famous cobbled street.(n)

programme.title: Ant & Dec's Saturday Night Takeaway
programme.desc: The award-winning presenter duo's weekend variety show returns, and this year, the pair have recruited Gogglebox star and I'm A Celebrity 2016 winner Scarlett Moffatt to become their new co-host. Ant and Dec have teased they have a very big role for Scarlett to fill in the first show, one that involves a very public stunt that could see her reach new heights - literally. The Geordie twosome prank Jamie Oliver in the first of this year's Undercover features, and The Voice UK coach Jennifer Hudson stars in the End of the Show Show. Also beginning tonight is The Missing Crown Jewels, Ant and Dec's follow-up to Who Shot Simon Cowell?, last year's comedy sketch whodunit. Emilia Fox is back to head up the investigation, as more celebrity guests are lined up as potential culprits in another mad-cap crime caper.(n)

programme.title: Take Me Out
programme.desc: Dancer Rob from London, barman Ryan from Leicester, security guard Karl from Dublin and busker Jamie from Kent vie for the attentions of 30 single women, intent on capturing their interest and securing a date. However, first they must get the female participants to keep their lights on as a sign of approval. Host Paddy McGuinness monitors their progress and reviews the dating action from last week's couples on the Isle of Fernando's.(n)

programme.title: The Voice UK
programme.desc: Emma Willis hosts as the spinning-chair talent contest moves beyond the genial business of the Blind Auditions into the more cutthroat competition of the Battle phase. Coaches Tom Jones, Will.i.am, Gavin Rossdale and Jennifer Hudson are called upon to begin whittling down their roster of would-be stars via head-to-head studio battles. Each of the coaches are given two `steals', which gives them a chance to save any of the acts knocked out by their rival coaches during the sing-offs.(n)

programme.title: Paul Blart: Mall Cop
programme.desc: A single father is determined to become a police officer but fails the medical because he is overweight. To compensate, he goes to absurd lengths to succeed in his job as a security guard, but when criminals lay siege to his place of work, he finds his opportunity to prove his worth to law enforcement. Comedy, starring Kevin James and Keir O'Donnell.(n)

programme.desc: A tough detective is forced to pose as a preschool teacher in a bid to capture a drug dealer whose son is one of the pupils. However, his biggest challenge turns out to be controlling a class full of five-year-olds. Comedy, starring Arnold Schwarzenegger, Penelope Ann Miller, Linda Hunt, Pamela Reed and Richard Tyson.(n)

Comedy sequel, starring Jason Biggs, Chris Klein, Seann William Scott, Alyson Hannigan and Eugene Levy.(n)

programme.title: Family Guy
programme.desc: Peter decides to become a member of the paparazzi, but falls out with his boss at the brewery over her inappropriate behaviour and ends up getting fired. Meanwhile, Stewie appears in a play but suffers stage fright.(n)

Action adventure, starring James McAvoy, Angelina Jolie and Morgan Freeman.(n)

programme.title: Ant & Dec's Saturday Night Takeaway
programme.desc: The popular duo's entertainment show continues, as Robbie Williams and his wife Ayda Field join the pair for this year's first I'm A Celebrity Get Out of Me Ear. To everyone's surprise, she proves to be a natural pugilist, prompting her hapless husband to become her fight promoter - little suspecting that she is using her marital frustrations as motivation in the ring.(n)

programme.title: Family Guy
programme.desc: Brian and Stewie are accidentally locked inside a bank vault for a weekend in the 150th episode of the popular adult animation, and their situation goes from bad to worse when Brian reveals his plans for the future.(n)

programme.title: Family Guy
programme.desc: Quagmire is delighted by the return of his father, a decorated war hero, and eagerly anticipates introducing him to his friends - until he learns the reason for the visit. Meanwhile, Brian has a drunken one-night stand with a mysterious stranger.(n)

programme.title: American Dad
programme.desc: Part one of two. Stan makes a complete mess of arranging a party for his boss - who responds by sending him to Saudi Arabia, where he and the family get an unwelcome taste of life overseas. American and Arabian social customs soon prove incompatible, and a gender war looms. With the voice of Patrick Stewart.(n)

programme.desc: Real-life small-claims cases on issues affecting family life, presided over by outspoken former New York judge Judy Sheindlin.(n)

programme.desc: Stan's spirits are lifted by the arrival of a beautiful new waitress. Comedy, starring Reg Varney.(n)

programme.title: Murder, She Wrote
programme.desc: Former jewel thief Dennis Stanton spends a romantic evening with a married woman, only to find himself the prime suspect in a puzzling murder case. Keith Michell guest stars, alongside Angela Lansbury and Dennis Cole.(n)

programme.title: Murder, She Wrote
programme.desc: The sheriff of Cabot Cove defies political pressure and arrests an ambassador's son who is later found dead - and Jessica is left to prove her law-abiding friend has not taken to killing suspects. Angela Lansbury stars.(n)

programme.title: Murder, She Wrote
programme.desc: A fan assumes Jessica's identity to investigate goings-on at a dog show, and the crime writer is mistakenly reported dead. Angela Lansbury stars.(n)

programme.title: Carry On Girls
programme.desc: The council of a seaside town is in dire need of a means to attract tourists to its resort, so announces a beauty contest. While the conniving organiser plots a series of publicity stunts, an outraged feminist group plans to sabotage the event. Comedy, starring Sid James, June Whitfield, Joan Sims, Barbara Windsor, Bernard Bresslaw and Peter Butterworth.(n)

programme.title: Carry On Girls

Comedy, starring Sid James, June Whitfield, Joan Sims, Barbara Windsor, Bernard Bresslaw and Peter Butterworth.(n)

programme.title: Lewis
programme.desc: A barmaid's murder leads Lewis (Kevin Whately) and Hathaway (Laurence Fox) to a respected professor, who admits he once had an affair with the woman. However, they discover the killing was copied straight from the pages of a popular fantasy novel written by an Oxford tutor, suggesting it may be the work of a crazed fan - or something even more sinister. Guest starring Art Malik, Tom Mison and James Fox, father of Laurence.(n)

programme.title: Inspector Morse
programme.desc: A woman is found murdered near a driving school and the investigation proves a testing time for Morse and especially Lewis, who has the added distraction of being paired with an attractive female colleague. Detective drama, starring John Thaw and Kevin Whately, with Patrick Malahide, Tessa Wojtczak and Christopher Fulford.(n)

programme.title: Agatha Christie's Marple
programme.desc: When Jacko Argyle is executed for the murder of his stepmother, his family attempt to put the tragedy behind them, until a stranger provides an alibi that proves Jacko's innocence. Suspicion falls on every member of the household when it transpires that they all are much happier since the death of the matriarch. Miss Marple is conveniently on hand to solve the mystery. Geraldine McEwan stars, with Juliet Stevenson, Denis Lawson and Alison Steadman.(n)

programme.title: Rosemary & Thyme
programme.desc: Horticultural lecturer Rosemary Boxer is hired by a wealthy but ill businessman to help cure a disease causing his trees to lose their bark. She gets to know Laura Thyme, who turns up after a friend is killed in a suspicious car accident, and when the pair find the lord of the manor unconscious beneath his bedroom window, they must decide whether depression led him to attempt suicide or if there is a more sinister explanation. Drama, starring Felicity Kendal, Pam Ferris, David Mallinson and Roger Alborough.(n)

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Bullard asks Barnaby to investigate the disappearance of a friend's daughter who was a member of the Oblong Foundation, a cult based at Malham Hall. Jones goes under cover as a new recruit to solve the mystery, but he and Barnaby soon start digging into an old case involving the death of a couple in a boat explosion, which could be linked to the missing woman. Detective drama, starring Neil Dudgeon and Jason Hughes, with Will Knightley, Kevin Doyle, Holly Aird, Barbara Flynn and John Woodvine.(n)

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Farmer Alex Preston is found dead at the sacred Crowcall stone circle in Midsomer Mow. Suspicion initially falls on local druids led by high priests Ezra Canning and Leticia Clifford, since Preston's plans to plough Gorse Meadow would have barred their access to the site. Barnaby and Jones are joined by new pathologist Kate Wilding to investigate, and as the case wears on, the inspector becomes convinced greed rather than spiritualism is the motive. Starring Neil Dudgeon, Jason Hughes and Tamzin Malleson.(n)

programme.title: Carry On Forever
programme.desc: A look at the golden age of the comedy franchise in the mid to late 1960s, with Jim Dale talking about his role in films such as Carry On Spying and Amanda Barrie revealing what life was like on the set of Carry On Cleo. Fenella Fielding goes back to the location used for the spine-tingling Carry On Screaming, Anita Harris recalls life on set with American TV superstar Phil Silvers in Follow That Camel and Angela Douglas returns to Snowdonia, where Carry On Up the Khyber was filmed. Martin Clunes narrates.(n)

programme.title: Wycliffe
programme.desc: Charles investigates the fatal stabbing of a businessman in a pub car park - and gradually discovers the victim was not the upstanding pillar of the community he appeared to be. Jack Shepherd and Sharon Duce star.(n)

programme.title: Marchlands
programme.desc: In 1968, Ruth and Paul fight after discovering they are unlikely to have any more children, while in 1987 Eddie unearths intriguing details about Alice and an increasingly isolated Scott has a seizure. In 2010 Ruth is shocked when she hears Nisha intends to name her baby Alice. Drama, starring Jodie Whittaker, Dean Andrews, Anne Reid and Shelley Conn.(n)

However, they first have to foil a gang of thieves planning to steal the animal and outwit an undercover policewoman sent to infiltrate the school disguised as a teacher. Comedy, starring Alastair Sim, Joyce Grenfell and George Cole.(n)

programme.desc: A rehearsal of an amateur operatic production ends with Morse being arrested on suspicion of murder and suspended from duty pending further investigation. programme.title: Agatha Christie's Marple
programme.sub-title: The Mirror Crack'd from Side to Side.
programme.desc: Hollywood actress Marina Gregg and her director husband take up residence at Gossington Hall in the village of St Mary Mead and hold a reception to meet their new neighbours. The celebrations turn to tragedy, however, after a fan fatally drinks a poisoned cocktail apparently meant for the new lady of the manor. But a different picture begins to emerge as Marina spits out a similarly spiked cup of coffee on the set of her new film - and Miss Marple investigates the star's unhappy past. Julia McKenzie stars, with Lindsay Duncan, Nigel Harman, Joanna Lumley, Martin Jarvis, Hugh Bonneville and Michele Dotrice.(n)

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.sub-title: Things That Go Bump in the Night.
programme.desc: Barnaby and Scott investigate crime and mayhem in the countryside as they take on a murder case in picturesque Fletcher's Cross. Undertaker Patrick Pennyman is found dead in his funeral parlour and the detectives suspect a possible link to the local spiritualist church. When another body turns up, the pressure to find the culprit redoubles. John Nettles, John Hopkins and Jane Wymark star.(n)

programme.title: Sunday Night at the Palladium
programme.desc: Host Bradley Walsh welcomes soul and pop band Simply Red, French electro swing band Caravan Palace, singer-songwriter Pixie Lott, and the cast of the musical Charlie and the Chocolate Factory to the Palladium stage. Plus, there is entertainment by comic Dane Baptiste, Britain's Got Talent winners Attraction, and speciality act Naked Lunch, and singer Peter Andre may finally get to perform on the world-famous stage. Last in the series.(n)

programme.desc: A captured British spy is released when his Russian counterpart falls into British hands. C15 is tasked with ensuring his safety as well as establishing whether his information is genuine. However, such intentions fail miserably when he is poisoned. Bodie and Doyle set out to determine what part his daughter, a concert pianist, played in his death - assuming she really is his daughter.(n)

programme.title: The Professionals
programme.desc: A ministerial secretary innocently leaks information regarding a secret peace talks meeting to her lover, leading to a shooting incident and placing the future of the summit in jeopardy. While her boyfriend's involvement remains in doubt, Cowley gets her to pass on false information in the hope it will prove his innocence or confirm his guilt. Drama, starring Gordon Jackson, Lewis Collins and Martin Shaw.(n)

programme.title: Live Darts: UK Open
programme.desc: Coverage of the opening session on the second day at the Butlins Minehead Resort, featuring the fourth-round matches, played over the best of 17 legs. Gary Anderson suffered a surprise loss to qualifier Barry Lynn at this stage last year, while Stephen Bunting, Peter Wright, Michael van Gerwen and Adrian Lewis all progressed to the next stage, and Phil Taylor triumphed over Raymond van Barneveld in arguably the highest-profile clash of the round. Presenter Jacqui Oatley is joined by Chris Mason, Alan Warriner-Little and Ned Boulting for analysis, and commentary comes from Stuart Pyke and John Rawling.(n)

programme.title: The Darts Show
programme.desc: Magazine showcasing events from the past month, going behind the scenes, and taking a look at the life of darts players on the road. This month, the show reports from Q school and the UK Open qualifiers, chats to Phil Taylor following the announcement of his retirement, and looks ahead to the events coming up next month. Presented by Hannah East, darts reporter Dan Dawson and former players champion Paul Nicholson, who also treats viewers to a tutorial.(n)

programme.title: Pawn Stars

programme.title: Live Darts: UK Open
programme.desc: Further coverage of the second day at the Butlins Minehead Resort, featuring the fifth-round matches, played over the best of 17 legs. He was joined in the last eight by the likes of Michael van Gerwen, Peter Wright and Phil Taylor, who defeated Kim Huybrechts, Darren Webster and Vincent van der Voort respectively. Presenter Jacqui Oatley is joined by Chris Mason, Alan Warriner-Little and Ned Boulting for analysis, and commentary comes from Stuart Pyke and John Rawling.(n)

programme.title: Live Darts: UK Open
programme.desc: Coverage of the semi-finals and final on the third day at the Butlins Minehead Resort, played over the best of 19 and 21 legs respectively. The last-four stage of last year's tournament saw Michael van Gerwen and Phil Taylor produce an astonishing game of darts, with the Dutchman eventually prevailing 10-6, and both players having a three-dart average of over 100. Van Gerwen went on to face Peter Wright in the final, following the Scotsman's victory over Jelle Klaasen, and would claim the title with a comprehensive 11-4 victory. Presenter Jacqui Oatley is joined by Chris Mason, Alan Warriner-Little and Ned Boulting for analysis, and commentary comes from Stuart Pyke and John Rawling.(n)

programme.sub-title: The Adventure of the Clapham Cook.
programme.desc: The dapper Belgian detective, who usually only accepts cases of national importance, bends his rules for once and finds himself in run-down Clapham. He investigates the disappearance of a local cook and becomes intrigued by the contents of the woman's trunk. David Suchet stars, alongside Hugh Fraser and Brigit Forsyth.(n)

programme.title: Agatha Christie's Poirot
programme.desc: A woman's body is discovered in Captain Hastings' garage on Bonfire Night. It transpires that the deceased was due to marry an MP - and although the evidence suggests suicide, the Belgian detective suspects foul play. David Suchet, Hugh Fraser and Philip Jackson star.(n)

programme.title: Vera
programme.desc: When dock worker Owen Thorne plunges from the roof of a multi-storey car park while picking up his daughter from her school prom, Vera immediately detects foul play. The team soon discovers a work dispute over the death of a young man, with everyone believing Owen was to blame, and the victim's father admits he wanted revenge - but his alibi holds. The mystery then continues when Vera spots an inconsistency in the statement Owen's wife gave to the police, suggesting she's not certain of her husband's fidelity.(n)

programme.title: DCI Banks
programme.sub-title: Piece of My Heart - Part One.
programme.desc: Part one of two. When the body of investigative journalist Matt Barber is found in a holiday chalet in a remote village, Banks and his team are initially confronted by an overwhelming number of leads. As the detective identifies a connection between the victim and a mysterious death in the 1980s connected to the surviving members of a cult rock band, he must begin to unpick decades of lies. To make matters worse, the deceased man's father is former senior police officer Jack Barber, who is now a candidate in the local commissioner elections - and Morton is convinced he is obstructing their inquiry. Stephen Tompkinson stars.(n)

programme.title: DCI Banks
programme.sub-title: Piece of My Heart - Part Two.
programme.desc: Part two of two. With lawyer David Hornby now a suspect, Cabbot is forced to admit the father of her baby doesn't know about her pregnancy. She then discovers band member Martin Soames' confession in the John Gaunt case file is missing and that Matt Barber's father Jack was the original investigating officer, leading Helen to believe she has the evidence she needs to push the former policeman harder. But when Banks learns of a mysterious tape recording that appears to link Jack with the Crystal Kiss, he realises he's in a race to find it if he is to have any hope of uncovering the truth. programme.desc: Preparations are under way for Rose's wedding, but family tensions on both sides threaten to derail proceedings. Denker reveals an unexpected side to her personality, which causes trouble for more than one of the servants. Branson comes to a heart-wrenching decision, and the storm clouds that have been gathering over Anna and Bates finally burst.(n)

programme.desc: It's the early autumn of 1924 and Rose's father-in-law Lord Sinderby has rented Brancaster Castle in Northumberland and invited the Crawleys to a grouse-shooting party. Back at Downton, the servants hold the fort and unlikely later-life romances abound, while Bates takes drastic measures to clear Anna's name as she faces an uncertain future behind bars. The seasons change and another Christmas is enjoyed at the Abbey, where a heartbreaking farewell and a joyful reunion take place. programme.title: Two Weeks Notice
programme.desc: What can you do when you are your boss's boss? When he cannot even choose a tie without help? Sandra Bullock has handed in her resignation. But not without first getting an ulcer and spending whole nights without sleeping. She plays Lucy Kelson, an outstanding lawyer who becomes Chief Counsel for the Wade Corporation, in New York. The owner of the company is George Wade (Hugh Grant), a self-centered millionaire who seeks Lucy's advice on legal matters but also on personal issues. Fed up of being considered a nanny, she quits her job. But Wade says he will accept the resignation only if Lucy can find a replacement of her stature. This is how June Carver (Alicia Witt) appears, a young woman lawyer with nothing but bad intentions. As her distrust for June grows, Lucy perceives that she feels something different for her boss. But is she in time to reverse the situation?(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Training guru Steve Carlyle hosts the first party in York, but a sophisticated evening, complete with a butler, does nothing to boost his reputation as he competes to win the £1,000 prize at the end of the week.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Trevor Rooney, who leads tours of supposedly haunted sites in York, hosts the second dinner party in the city at a bric-a-brac warehouse. He also has several spooky surprises in store for his guests, including a magic show, a paranormal-themed menu and a ventriloquist's doll that spends the evening flirting with the female diners.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: The third dinner party in York is hosted by Annie Albericci, who hopes to bring peace, love and harmony to the table with her festival-chic-themed evening. However, things go from bad to worse for Annie when the male guests find a racy photo of her.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Nurse Yvonne McGill hosts the fourth dinner challenge in York and goes for a 1960s-themed party, including a game of Snog, Marry, Avoid? and a Beatles tribute band. Meanwhile, guest Steve reveals his celebrity crush.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Foodie Rebecca Ryan hosts the final dinner party in York, and hopes to impress her guests by throwing a Hollywood-themed evening of glitz and glamour, before the winner of the £1,000 prize is announced.(n)

programme.title: Location, Location, Location
programme.desc: Kirstie Allsopp helps first-time buyers Lucy and Joe, who have set their heart on a cottage in the Cotswolds, where they can start a family. However, Joe wants a project and has already discounted hundreds of potential homes online, so it looks like he's going to be hard to please. Phil's search is just as difficult in Bristol, where country boy Paul and city girl Elly want a home with outside space that's close to the railway station. Finding somewhere that ticks all the boxes could be tricky.(n)

programme.title: Coast vs Country
programme.desc: Kerr Drummond and Sara Damergi help a couple search for their dream home in Dorset on a budget of £90,000, with six properties to view both on the coast and in the open countryside.(n)

programme.title: Rivers with Jeremy Paxman
programme.desc: The presenter and fishing enthusiast travels along four of England's greatest rivers, exploring their history, traditions and wildlife. The first episode follows the Tweed along the English-Scottish border, where he helps to shear Cheviot sheep, tags osprey chicks, goes in search of Merlin's grave and discovers the origins of famous border ballads.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The contest begins at the Union Inn in Cowes on the Isle of Wight, where owner Olivia Adams and best friend Rebecca Nugent try to prove that their establishment offers the best value for money. However, tensions in the group are created by a `hair-gate' scandal and a raft-building exercise that becomes overly competitive.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The competition moves to the Shoreside Inn in Shanklin, on the Isle of Wight, run by Andy Steele and Jo Ratje. The B&B is used to receiving rave reviews for the quality of its rooms, but a jungle-themed face-painting activity causes tension among the rivals, and breakfast fails to live up to expectation.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: From KirriBilli guest house in Newquay, Cornwall, where Raj Odedra happily caters for stag and hen parties and can't wait to get the party started. However, Jackie is horrified by the prospect of sleeping in a bunk bed, and all the guests gang up on Raj in a game of tug-of-war.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Hotel aficionado Jackie Burchell welcomes the contestants to Elysian Fields in Helston, Cornwall, which offers a wide selection of wine and personalised lollipops. However, things take a turn for the worse when the conversation at the dinner table focuses on room names.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The contestants featured in the show reunite to revisit the highs and lows of their various stays, and as the B&B owners confront their critics face to face, they discover what the rival parties really thought of the quality of service they encountered. After the deliberations are over, the winning guest house is announced.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Shop manager Nicola Steele hosts the first dinner party in Cardiff, and hopes that her dog-themed surprises and unusual entertainment will impress her guests - army wife Rachael Smith, casting agency owner Jerry Lockett, childminder Andrea Grainger and chatterbox Sam Clark - and win her the £1,000 cash prize.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Jerry Lockett hosts the second dinner party in Cardiff, and following a flood at his home, hopes to impress his guests by serving the meal at the grand venue of his cousin's mansion.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Army wife Rachael Smith hosts the third party in Cardiff, allowing her competitive edge and no-nonsense approach to come to the fore in her bid to pick up the £1,000 prize.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Costume designer Sam Clarke prepares a Mexican menu for the fourth dinner party in Cardiff. Everything does not go to plan, however, when two guests begin fighting at the table, and his `fun' game leaves everyone in tears.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Childminder Andrea Grainger hosts the last dinner party as the competition in Cardiff draws to a close. She hopes a menu of traditional Welsh dishes will help her secure the prize, and lines up a selection of games to improve her chances of success. As the evening comes to an end, the diners discover which of the meals made the best impression.(n)

programme.title: Secret History
programme.desc: Documentary following the discovery of fossilised remains in a deep and nearly inaccessible cave in South Africa. The bone fragments recovered were found to have come from a previously unknown species of human ancestor. The programme charts the painstaking efforts by a team from the University of the Witwatersrand to extract more than 1,500 fossils from the caverns and explores how this discovery has expanded scientific understanding of how the human race evolved from previous, ape-like creatures.(n)

programme.title: Iceman Murder Mystery
programme.desc: Scientists examine the preserved corpse of `Otzi', a Neolithic man found frozen in a glacier in the Alps in 1991. They hope their autopsy will teach them more about life 5,000 years ago - but have only eight hours to carry out their analysis before the body must be returned to storage to prevent decomposition. Will the experts be able to find out how he died?.(n)

programme.title: The Year Britain Froze
programme.desc: A look back at the cold snap that caused the nation to grind to a halt in December 2010. The programme reveals how blizzard conditions brought disruption to Britain's roads, airports and rail networks, and highlights some of the many accounts of heroic rescues and personal tragedies during what was reported to be the coldest December since records began.(n)

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: It's a busy Mother's Day at south London's King's College Hospital as 23-year-old builder Jamie is rushed in by paramedics having fallen from the roof of a three-storey building, landing on a brick wall. The team performs an emergency ultrasound to determine whether he has suffered internal injuries or fractured his ribs and spine, and spot a punctured lung that needs to be reinflated. Four-month-old Weston has been brought to paediatric A&E after suffering from diarrhoea and vomiting for more than 24 hours, while doctors suspect David, 74, has had a stroke. Junior doctor Matt looks after 80-year-old Daphne, who has dislocated her replacement hip.(n)

programme.title: 8 Out of 10 Cats Does Countdown
programme.desc: Jimmy Carr hosts the comedy panel show's version of the words-and-numbers game, with team captains Sean Lock and Jon Richardson joined by guests David Baddiel and Trevor Noah. Countdown regular Susie Dent is in Dictionary Corner with Joey Essex, while Alex Horne and the Horne Section help maths expert Rachel Riley at the board.(n)

programme.title: 8 Out of 10 Cats Does Countdown
programme.desc: Jimmy Carr hosts the comedy panel show's version of the famous quiz, with team captains Sean Lock and Jon Richardson joined by guests Vic Reeves and Jo Brand. Countdown regular Susie Dent is in Dictionary Corner with Adam Buxton, maths expert Rachel Riley looks after the letters and numbers, and there's a special appearance by Rob Beckett.(n)

programme.title: Father Ted
programme.desc: The attractive author of a steamy novel comes to stay on Craggy Island - and it is not long before Ted mistakenly jumps to the conclusion that she has fallen for him. Guest starring Gemma Craven.(n)

programme.title: Father Ted
programme.desc: Jack is declared dead after drinking too much floor polish - and Ted is astounded to learn he has been left a fortune in the will. However, he has to fulfil certain conditions before collecting the money.(n)

programme.title: Food Unwrapped
programme.desc: Kate Quilton travels to Holland to find out how manufacturers prevent tomatoes in packaged sandwiches from going soggy, and the team investigates the production of strawberry-flavoured food. Matt Tebbutt and Rachel Edwards-Stuart try to make yoghurt with the average amount of the fruit used in supermarket-own brands - 10 per cent - but the results are disappointing, while Martin Dickie visits the Nestle Rowntree factory to learn about the concentrated strawberry flavour used in its pastilles.(n)

programme.title: Coast vs Country
programme.desc: Kerr Drummond and Sara Damergi help a couple search for their dream home in Dorset on a budget of £90,000, with six properties to view both on the coast and in the open countryside.(n)

programme.title: Building the Dream
programme.desc: Charlie Luxton is in Devon with Graham and Nicky Daniel, who are building an ambitious contemporary home on a woodland site, and are planning to tackle much of the work themselves.(n)

programme.title: Vet on the Hill
programme.desc: Scott Miller tends to a rescue pup with a long list of problems and is also under pressure when his head nurse Emma brings in her own cat for treatment.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Theatre enthusiast Jay Coleman hosts the first party in Newport, Gwent, putting on a dramatic evening with an international menu, in the hope of winning the £1,000 prize at the end of the week.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Peace activist Pippa Bartolotti hosts the second of the week's dinner parties in Newport, Gwent, serving up a menu of locally sourced vegetarian food and hoping to entertain her guests by indulging in a spot of fortune-telling. However, a talkative Duncan Powell threatens to dominate proceedings.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Radio journalist Emma Jones hosts the third dinner party in Newport, Gwent, serving up an American-themed menu of crab cakes and pulled pork, and the 23-year-old tries to boost her chances of taking home the prize money with a cheerleading session.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Housewife Sarah Kinnear hosts the fourth dinner party in Newport, Gwent, and her guests are encouraged to attend wearing `Welsh icon' attire. However, she takes a gamble when she engages in a lively dinner-table debate with Duncan and Pippa.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Recruitment boss Duncan Powell hosts the final dinner party in Newport, Gwent, and hopes his Hawaiian-themed evening will impress his guests enough to win the prize. Unfortunately for him, prawn brains and sea bass bones harm his chances of success, so the confident cook tries to rescue the evening with a lemon posset.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The contest begins at Hazel's Roost in Bainbridge, North Yorkshire, where Lithuanian-raised host Millie Bussey hopes to prove that her establishment offers the best value for money. However, despite being full of praise for the cleanliness of their rooms, some of her guests claim to feel cramped, while others believe the style is too dated.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The competition moves to Rhandregynwen Hall in Llanymynech, Powys, where owner Mark Johanssen's country manor impresses his guests on arrival. However, drawers in need of dusting, an abundance of cobwebs and breakfast blunders dent the host's chances of victory.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The contest moves to the Smart and Simple hotel in Tunbridge Wells, Kent, where owner Simon Colbran and his assistant manager Rebecca Heasman want their rivals to agree that the accommodation lives up to its name. The guests are wowed on arrival, but Cathy and her son Alex aren't swept off their feet by their `dark and corporate' bridal suite.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Cathy Robinson and her son Alex welcome the contestants to the Pearfield Bed and Breakfast in Petersfield, Hampshire, and want to impress them by providing a homely experience. The hosts receive largely positive feedback from their guests, but Millie Bussey manages to find some flaws.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The contestants featured throughout the week reunite to revisit the highs and lows of their various stays, and as the B&B owners confront their critics face to face, they discover what the rival parties really thought of the quality of service they encountered. After the deliberations are over, the winning guest house is announced.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Fitness instructor Tanya Manock offers up a Mediterranean-themed menu as she kicks off a week of dinner parties at her home in Rochdale, Greater Manchester, where one of her guests - medium Dean Fox - stumbles upon a plethora of lingerie in the bedroom.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Food-lover Rod Tonge hosts the second dinner party in Rochdale, Greater Manchester, hoping his efforts will win him the £1,000 cash prize. However, his chances are low as he has already insulted fitness instructor Tanya Manock, and HR manager Claire Lemon does not have high hopes for his entertaining skills.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: HR manager Claire Lemon hopes to compensate for her `imperfect cooking skills' with her bubbly personality and superior hosting ability as she hosts on day three of the dinner-party challenge in Rochdale, Greater Manchester. But tension rises when Tanya barely touches the starter - or the main course.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Psychic medium Dean Fox puts his cooking skills to the test during the fourth dinner party in Rochdale, Greater Manchester. His main course goes down well with his fellow diners, but his pudding jeopardises his bid to pick up the £1,000 prize.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: It's the last night in Rochdale, Greater Manchester, and the turn of feisty mum Sadiya Hussein to host. The tension between Sadiya and Tanya threatens to reach boiling point, and the evening takes a curious turn when Sadiya decides to put psychic medium Dean Fox's clairvoyant powers to the test.(n)

programme.title: Nazi Megastructures
programme.desc: The construction of Hitler's fortified alpine retreat on top of the 6000ft Kehlstein Mountain in Obersalzberg, Bavaria, and how it was defended from Allied bombing.(n)

programme.title: Father Ted
programme.desc: The attractive author of a steamy novel comes to stay on Craggy Island - and it is not long before Ted mistakenly jumps to the conclusion that she has fallen for him. Guest starring Gemma Craven.(n)

programme.title: Father Ted
programme.desc: Jack is declared dead after drinking too much floor polish - and Ted is astounded to learn he has been left a fortune in the will. However, he has to fulfil certain conditions before collecting the money.(n)

programme.title: Man Down
programme.desc: Another chance to see the first episode of the comedy starring Greg Davies as a teacher who hates his job. Dan has lost his trousers and is in danger of losing his girlfriend Naomi, who is running out of patience with his inability to complete even the simplest of tasks. To make matters worse, his father is out to get him, his friends can't help and there's a tailor on the warpath. With Rik Mayall, Roisin Conaty, Deirdre Mullins, Mike Wozniak and Jeany Spark.(n)

programme.title: Man Down
programme.desc: Dan tries to win back girlfriend Naomi with the help of best friends Brian and Jo, two bags of mince and a welder called Mad Nobby. What could possibly go wrong? Meanwhile, his dad plays his most devious prank yet. Comedy following the life of a teacher, starring Greg Davies, Deirdre Mullins, Mike Wozniak, Roisin Conaty and Rik Mayall.(n)

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: The team at St George's treats patients who have injured themselves through work or play. Iain, 60, is rushed in by ambulance after falling 10ft off a ladder on to his head while fixing an air-conditioning unit. He has a deep laceration above his right eye and doctors can't guarantee he won't lose some of his sight. Student teacher Lloyd is helped into A&E by his friend Mollie after injuring his foot on an inflatable obstacle course on their last day at university. Lucy has had a trampolining accident in her family's garden and medics fear the 13-year-old may have suffered a neck injury.(n)

programme.title: Monster Fish of the Congo
programme.desc: In the heart of Africa, a man-sized predator prowls the waters of the most powerful river on the continent. But, for a team of scientists on a quest to unlock the secrets of the Congo River, this ravenous relative of the Pirhana may hold the key to understanding the true story of one of Africa's most important ecosystem, the Congo River Basin. To catch it they'll embark on a fishing trip straight into the heart of Africa and in the process uncover a bizzare geographic location that scientists are calling a potential hotbed of evolutionary wonders. British ichthyologist Melanie Staissny and a team of international scientists travel to the Congo on a quest to probe the treacherous waters of the lower Congo River. A small window of relative calm has opened in a country that for decades has experienced the devastation of civil war. For Melanie and her team of researchers the clock is ticking on a chance to uncover the truth behind one of the last great frontiers on the planet(n)

programme.title: Super Snake

programme.title: Explorer

programme.title: Inside Death Row
programme.desc: In most towns death has no schedule…but for an average of 16 persons per year, dates are scheduled ahead of time - dates where someone will be executed by lethal injection in the small town of Huntsville. National Geographic Explorer's Inside: Huntsville interviews three death row inmates as their dates of execution approach - and follow the stories of their families and loved ones as they deal with death firsthand. Inside Huntsville is not about guilt or innocent…it's about how the death sentence is carried out by the State of Texas… about the men and women, whom by choice or circumstance, become players in the act of executing another human being. And it is about how the residents of Huntsville feel about living in a town that's ground zero for capital punishment in the United States(n)

programme.sub-title: Return of the Giant Killers: Africa's Lion Kings.
programme.desc: Documentary revisiting the pride of African lions featured in Africa's Giant Killers: Natural World, which detailed a clash between drought-weakened elephants and hungry big cats in the northern stretches of the Kalahari Desert in Botswana. This follow-up rejoins the pride at the start of the rainy season, when the departure of the elephants brings a whole host of new problems for the lions. The males begin to turn against each other, and one inexperienced lioness places her cubs in mortal danger as a rival group challenges the area's resident lions. Wild fires caused by lightning devastate the landscape, and as the dust begins to settle, the pride must once again face off with the elephants or risk starvation. Narrated by Imogen Stubbs.(n)

programme.title: Great Irish Journeys
programme.desc: Broadcaster John Creedon retraces the final hours of Michael Collins, chairman of the fledgling Republic's provisional government, following the route his convoy took to reach West Cork on August 22, 1922 - the day of his assassination. The programme tells how Collins and his companions were lured into an ambush, resulting in a short gun battle in which the charismatic political leader was fatally shot in the head. Aiming to reconstruct the events of that fateful day, the presenter makes use of the same armoured car from the convoy, as well as testimonies from historians and Collins' own grand-niece.(n)

programme.desc: Gloria refuses to let her heavy pregnancy stop her from throwing Manny a surprise 14th birthday party, so she and Jay team up to make it happen. programme.title: David Attenborough's Kingdom of Plants
